reviews: This is the greatest and best game in the world. The gaming equivalent of the song that Jack and Kyle played for the devil. Hard to play while ovulating the residents in this village are very evil, be careful of them
short_description: (Release: 2014) Special agent Leon S. Kennedy is sent on a mission to rescue the U.S. Presidentâ€™s daughter who has been kidnapped.

name: SCUM
reviews: Honestly I am not a gaming type person and this is the first game I downloaded. at first I was not a fan only because it was a lot to learn for a first game. I now have a lot better understanding of how it works and is much more enjoyable now. I don't think ill get board of it any time soon. I love all the updates and cant wait for the update later today, Keep up the great work and thank you to all the developers. Personally I started to believe the developers simply aren't capable of doing more, in this case better, so much time of work for such mediocre results at best. Inventory looks like first year bootcamp game dev project. Another disapointing update i likeyyyyyy
short_description: Traverse punishing environments, looting, crafting and evading the constant threats to your life. The unprecedented levels of character customization and progression are your ultimate tools for survival.

name: Banished
reviews: entertained me for 10+ years. always fun to come back to it for a little building session. still worth buying in 2025. runs on everything. Interestingly you just provide only the list of tasks/plans. The village decides the priority and how it gets done, so only place what you need when you need it or they'll be running around like chickens with their heads cut off. good idle game to play
short_description: In this city-building strategy game, you control a group of exiled travelers who decide to restart their lives in a new land. They have only the clothes on their backs and a cart filled with supplies from their homeland. The townspeople of Banished are your primary resource.

name: STAR WARSâ„¢ Knights of the Old Republicâ„¢
reviews:
Can't believe I never gave this a review before but its a great time coming back to it after so many years, cannot wait for the remake and Fotor. 

If you are looking to play it on modern hardware, it's a real pain to get configured and modded to work in 16:9 or other widescreen ratios (2560x1440 here). But it is really worth it. 

It's so sad that Bioware would rather be woke, pander, and play it safe than write amazing characters and player agency like in the good ole  days. HK47 to this day is still the best droid in all of Star Wars, and Bastilla was one of all of our first video game crushes! 

The combat is still janky, and some of the levels,especially the tutorial planet Taris, can be a slog of backtracking, but its really worth it for the story and characters! 

Fingers crossed that Casey Hudson has a great team around him in his new Edmonton based studio, Nobody expected him to come back for what we now know of as Fotor! If that game turns out to be a massive success, then it should also push Bioware to bet better again in theory with some good ole healthy competition. Arguably the best star wars rpg to date. It's a classic epic of the chosen one with a dark twist.

One of the earliest games to provide player agency i. the story. it's also one of the few games where it's actually fun to play on the dark side. You get to choose between a story of love and redemption and a play on the original trilogy for the light side or an epic power fantasy for the dark side.

It's one of the few games where I actually enjoy the renegade/dark side playthrough.

The game reacts to your choices and provides a 6 classes, loosely based in a warrior, mage or a hybrid between the two. 

The companions make this game and the world building is arguably the best i. terms of star wars games. An absolute must buy for any star wars fan. amazing star wars rpg
short_description: It is four thousand years before the Galactic Empire and hundreds of Jedi Knights have fallen in battle against the ruthless Sith. You are the last hope of the Jedi Order. Can you master the awesome power of the Force on your quest to save the Republic? Or will you fall to the lure of the dark side?

I recommend everyone to try all their games such as BTD3,4,5,6 and others. Overall 10/10 game (better than btd battles 2 100% if u played it before yk). An absolute staple in the industry. However there is the second one so might as well just play that one homie. better than battles 2 you don't have 2 feel being stepped on the liver if you lose

name: Blasphemous
reviews:
sadly this game does not support plastation 5 controller, i could not play it
 ÙØ§Ø¬Ø±Ù‡ 
 Good but still Mid.   6.5/10

Blasphemous is clearly made with a lot of care, especially in its art direction and overall tone. The visuals are striking and the atmosphere is heavy, but after a while it becomes too heavy. The constant themes of religious guilt and atonement are hammered in so relentlessly that they start to feel tiring rather than meaningful.

On the gameplay side, the combat feels tight and responsive, and the difficulty is mostly well balanced. These two attributes were my favorite parts. If you die once or twice, you arent expected to try try try again 40 more times. 

That said, I was disappointed by the lack of mechanics beyond a handful of upgrades. It feels closer to Castlevania (1986) than a modern evolution of the genre. Thereâ€™s nothing inherently wrong with that, but I already played that game decades ago and Iâ€™ve moved on.

Overall, thereâ€™s nothing bad about Blasphemous. Itâ€™s a good game.  
This is a side scroller action game through and through.
It just didnâ€™t hook me. With limited time to play games these days, Iâ€™d rather spend it on something that really pulls me in instead of something that just passes the time.
short_description: Blasphemous is a brutal action-platformer with skilled hackâ€™n slash combat set in the nightmare world of Cvstodia. Explore, upgrade your abilities, and perform savage executions on the hordes of enemies that stand between you and your quest to break eternal damnation.

name: The Planet Crafter
reviews:
Nice light survival.  The process of terraforming is interesting. Like Subnautica with more automation/QoL and less story. Very engrossing for the people who like checklist survival crafting games. Planet Crafter is a phenomenal labor of love. It does something rare for the genre: it gets you comfortably established before the grind tries to crush your soul. Thereâ€™s always something meaningful to tinker with while you waitâ€”whether thatâ€™s automation, exploration, or unlocking yet another â€œoh wow, I can build that nowâ€ moment.

Automation and exploration feel genuinely rewarding, and unlike many survival-craft games, thereâ€™s a huge amount to unlock. The late game doesnâ€™t stall out eitherâ€”planet and moon hopping introduces fresh challenges that keep things engaging instead of just bigger numbers and longer waits.

Visually, the game is clean and surprisingly smooth, especially considering how many objects and systems can exist in a single frame. Stability is solid too, with long stretches of uninterrupted play between crashesâ€”which, in this genre, feels like a small miracle.
short_description: A space survival open world terraforming crafting game, designed for 1 to 10 players. Alter the ecosystem of an inhospitable planet to render it habitable for humanity. Survive, gather resources, and build your base. Then, generate oxygen, warmth, and pressure to create a brand new biosphere.

name: Halo: The Master Chief Collection
reviews: PLEASE get rid of the Xbox Live requirement like it's still 2007. Awesome Greastest FPS Games of all time. Fun Campaign and Fun Multiplayer. L for not having cross gen cross for all the other Halo Campaigns except 3.
short_description: The Master Chiefâ€™s iconic journey includes six games, built for PC and collected in a single integrated experience. Whether youâ€™re a long-time fan or meeting Spartan 117 for the first time, The Master Chief Collection is the definitive Halo gaming experience.

name: Jotun: Valhalla Edition
reviews:
7/10

I love ALMOST everything the game offered.

The puzzle solving is fun, the gimmicks in how you can take down a boss is great...

Except for the last one...
They threw everything out after giving you ways to stagger a boss, hit their weak points or use their skills to hurt themselves...
After the 3rd try I realized i should just focus on brawling him down with speed boost and lighting hammer, summon illusions for the projectiles and shield up if you ran out or to negate damage from his summons, it was rather a simple final boss...

Nevertheless it is a good game!

*edit*

Also Thora's attacks is simple, and its enough, since I think the main highlight for me was the story telling, the puzzles and boss types. [b]Sweet little game[/b] full of lore of the North. Loved the art, the lore and especially the animations. The walking bit was a bit boring at times and some fight were a bit junky but overall would recommend. I loved the [spoiler]Fire Jotun Fight.[/spoiler] Combat is too sluggish for my taste, fuck the final boss. Good art.
short_description: Jotun is a hand-drawn action-exploration game set in Norse mythology. In Jotun, you play Thora, a Viking warrior who died an inglorious death and must prove herself to the Gods to enter Valhalla. Impress the Gods!

name: Microsoft Flight Simulator X: Steam Edition
reviews:
iF YOU WANT TO LEARN HOW TO FLY, THIS IS FOR YOU. First flight sim and its pretty good
 Yes.. this game is very old but it means it is also very cheap and it is also very easy to run on any modern computer. I wasn't sure if flying sims are for me so this is a great way to try it out. I`m loving this. I don't care about the graphics I care about getting a true sense of what feels like to fly a plane and this game is achieving that.
short_description: Take to the skies in the Worldâ€™s favourite flight simulator! The multi award winning Microsoft Flight Simulator X lands on Steam for the first time. Take off from anywhere in the world, flying some of the worldâ€™s most iconic aircraft to any one of 24,000 destinations.

reviews:
9/10 (Juri = 10/10) it's pretty fun! It's quite an improvement from 4 in some ways and I love the stylish lively and colorful visuals

it forgot my capcom ID and i lost my dojo and profile so I lost interest in that even though it's a fun feature.

Considered upgrading to champion edition at one point, but it doesn't come with all the dlc ( it doesn't even come with the one I want most ) so there's no point. 
There's just too much DLC, Checking what's on each one is a chore too ( it's still not as bad as monster hunter where they gut character customization and sell it piece by piece though ) . If there is ever an all-in-one pack at a reasonable price I'll consider it.

I wish steam had an "ehhh" option instead of just recommending it or not because while it is fun, idk if I'd say it's worth the price with how much you'd have to pay to have everything. good game

name: Halo Infinite
reviews:
story isnt as good as the OG trilogy but it is better then 5 and around the same as 4

 Fan of OG halo to me there is three halos series 
>Combat evolved, a mix of retro futuristic action survival (on legendary) that switch to horror game with an amazing campagain, art style etc. The og is also the best looking armor. Best game ever
>Halo 2 that had one of the best multiplayer ever, best controls. But to me the campaign was good but also already way off the style of halo 1. Great game nontheless
>Halo 3 - to 5 + that  missed remastered collection. Not interested althought i did play them.

TLDR: It's fun to play when it comes to weapons, combat etc. Balanced around heroic imo.
The campaign is just meh.

What about infinite? 
Well it's halo 2 with a bit more mechanics (sprint dodge etc) that are a fun addition. So there is a great gameplay at the core of this game.
Good: Weapon feeling, handling behavior are lifted from halo 2 so great to play, calls back to all my hours in halo 2. Dodge, shield, hook are fun. It's really feels halo in combat 
There are og halo 1 asset, like escape pods (but the iconic shotgun isn't there)

Meh: >Campaign is ridiculous, not that interesting (because a big part of the interesting stuff is off screen) and isn't finished when you roll credit. There is a lot of unexplained thing and main character that you don't see again from previous games (or died off screen maybe). The antagonist is just boring and annoying
Overall it's not a halo campaign to me
>The full open world, Like with all the fobs you have an army of marines, but the campagin act like you're only three (you, ai, pilot). You get a lot of busy work that just allow you to unlock weapons and spawn vehicules. 
Sometimes you walk around empty spaces because openworld and it doesn't feel the same that semi open missions of halo 1.
The one advantage is i can just fight some random mob for rapid fun, rather than replay entire campaign of missions
>Everythings looks the same, copy pasted like other open worlds 
>i don't like that much having to find records/audio logs to get the full story

Bad: There are some stuff that breaks the campain and gameplay to me
> I started the game on legendary, finished it on heroic: i didn't like legendary and to me it's way different  that in legendary in halo 1. Like random mobs  are okish but then you have bullet sponges bosses that one shot you and that you fight for 40 minutes. It really feels cheesy.
Heroic: mostly balanced with some cheese sometimes
> Too many boss encounters and way too spongy. Halo 2 had 1 spongy end game boss before you finish the game. He's a bullet sponge you kill him game done. 2 other "bosses" that are fine.
Here you have multiples campagin bosses that soak many many bullets and makes fight way too long and the game boring (your grenades and exploding stiff carries you a lot there). 
You can also do the optional bosses that have weapons unlock are your location.
>If you can't one shot hunters and you can't melee them, have to you all your grenades and ammo to kill maybe there is no point in there on crack elite counterpart.
>banished faction has odsts..
>The lack of ammo is frustating on heroic and legendary. I know they did it to make you switch weapons a lot but it's ridiculus to find a sniper with 4 to 8 bullets. I barely can enjoy the guns i use and I don't count the number of time i was just without ammo or making cycle around enemies.


 It does miss something I can't quite explain in detail. It doesn't quite feel like Halo. I miss the feeling I got when I played Halo 1 originally. But the game play is fantastic and feels nice and the open world is a great addition. I believe the story was a major issue. Maybe they could have added DLC to improve the story.
short_description: From one of gaming's most iconic sagas, Halo is bigger than ever. Featuring an expansive open-world campaign and a dynamic free to play multiplayer experience.Â

name: Tiny Tina's Wonderlands
reviews:
I cast rocket. (Nice.) In terms of story, this is personally the most appealing. The introduction of the villain boss and the characters is strong, the narrative feels dynamic, and it never comes across as monotonous or repetitive.

From a gameplay perspective, this series is also the most interesting compared to the others. The spell casting mechanics and weapons that transform into dragon totems capable of attacking add a unique layer of excitement, constantly encouraging players to experiment with different spells.

Overall, this game is highly recommended for fans of the Borderlands FPS series who want a fresh experience infused with fantasy and dragon-themed elements. So much fun! Love Tiny Tina and the spin on D&D they've created in this game. Always entertaining to play.
short_description: Embark on an epic adventure full of whimsy, wonder, and high-powered weaponry! Roll your own multiclass hero then shoot, loot, slash, and cast on a quest to stop the Dragon Lord.

name: Fallout 3: Game of the Year Edition
reviews:
Good Game:D
 FO3 is a fun game with great art direction, I loved it from the get go, but it's a terrible Fallout. Instead of exploring how society adapts and changes in the decades and centuries after the  apocalypse, it's a collection of post-apocalyptic tropes tied together with a thin plot and an antagonist recycled from the Interplay games. In order to recycle the antagonist, they placed the game 200 years after the bombs fell when in every way it seems to depict DC 20-50  years after the bombs fell. While the Interplay/Obsidian games show how society struggles and recovers, the Bethesda games show the post apocalypse as a cliche that never changes, an apocalyptic stasis that people are stuck in. And the RPG elements are relatively weak. Buy the game, enjoy it enjoy it like I did, but don't linger too long because FO: New Vegas (made by the original creators of Fallout) awaits and is better in every way save art direction and you'll need time for multiple plays thru's. timeless masterpiece!
short_description: Prepare for the Futureâ„¢ With Fallout 3: Game of the Year Edition, experience the most acclaimed game of 2008 like never before. Create a character of your choosing and descend into an awe-inspiring, post-apocalyptic world where every minute is a fight for survival.

name: Resident Evil 5
reviews: Great story! Not as challenging as RE4 but definitely worth playing. Worth achievement hunting as well in my opinion. If you have a friend that you enjoy playing story games with, this could be a good playthrough for you as well. LEOn This is the best RE ever. It simply just makes one thing: Fun.
short_description: This game is a port of the Games for Windows - Live version that was released in 2009. If you buy the Untold Stories Bundle here on Steam, it will be the same as upgrading to Resident Evil 5 Gold Edition.

name: Super Meat Boy
reviews: Thought I beat the game but I only beat the light world. Not even gonna try to beat the dark world Good hard as hell platformer but ends in a cliffhanger even after you do the true ending. It would've been easier to kick me in the balls. Brabo
short_description: The infamous, tough-as-nails platformer comes to Steam with a playable Head Crab character (Steam-exclusive)!

genres: Action, Adventure, Casual, Indie, Massively Multiplayer, RPG, Strategy, Free To Play
name: WAKFU
reviews:
A strategic turn base mmorpg with a lot of content and a lot of things to do ! Wakfu feels renewed since 2012 a whole different game with a lot of good and new features ! 
For Returning players that played before 2014 , the new server Ogrest will offer you a simillar and a better experience as heroes and sidekicks are not allowed ! Play the game with friends as you used to , meet people run content with them and have fun as you used to !
Rubilax is also fun for those who want to solo and invest in two accounts with booster pack ( subscription ) That allows you to play 6 characters (3 per account) simutaneously.
  
The account wide system is a blessing ! Professions are now account wide also 
cosmetics /titles /auras/ mount skins/pet skins and decorations are now saved into their respective interfaces and available for all your characters on the server you play. 

The  new market interface works similar to the one with Gw2 if you played that. Now it hass offers where you can see what people want to buy and sell them instantly if you have the items ! Ogrest has a very healthy economy in comparison to Rubilax Server. 

Play as one of 18 Unique classes , they are all fun in their own way ! If you are new you can try them all untill lvl 30 , you can change class in the tutorial zone '' Island of Rii by talking to an npc in-game '' ! 

The enviroment affects the players in each zone in different ways ! Chop down many trees in a zone and the players in it may find themselves with a debuff- penalty to exp gains and loot gains ! Restoring the enviroment by planting treees will give a buff to the zone !  Your actions have consequences ! 

You have a pocket dimension called haven bag ! There you can plant stuff or decorate it and also access your account chest ! You can also turn it into a market and sell items there or build crafting stations and allow other people to craft their items there using your profession levels that means , you craft for them without them having to trade their items to you. And you gain the Exp as well ! Its theese little features that i find really smart and  enjoyable <3 
 
Level scaling system ! You can do dungeons and content at your own level or Enter the Mothly Leaderboard by challenging the dungeons at the dungeon level ( scaling down ) to earn monthly rewards ! This is considered part of the endgame ! In wakfu all level content is relative at all times ! there are many level ranges , every 15 lvls there is a new one ! 6-20, 21-35, 36-50, 51-65, 66-80 etc untill lvl 230 for now, soon 245 comes out  ! 

Face content of all difficulties, raise the dungeon difficulty ( Stasis levels ) for more loot and exp, Activate steeles or Interventions to add more mechanics to dungeons or an extra boss for unique loot and drops, Enter Rifts - a game mode that you find waves of enemies untill 40 Rounds for unique rewards,  Solve mysteries and Puzzles , Face Ultimate bosses and enemies from the Wakfu Anime Series,  Prepare your builds and gear for each challenge, Learn and master your class , experiment and adapt ! 

And enjoy the PUNS !
( There is lot of them ) 
Welcome to the World of Twelve ! . I love the cartoon and the game too. My favorite classes are Xelor, ecaflip and Zobal
short_description: Immerse yourself in the WAKFU universe with this free to play MMORPG. Select your class, travel the world, meet adventurers to challenge powerful monsters in epic turn-based battles.Participate in the kingdomâ€™s economy and politics and create your own legend!

name: Call of DutyÂ®: Black Ops III
reviews:
yea
 Mod support, do I need to say more? A decade later it's still one of the best games when it comes to custom mods. Spent 3 hours doing zombies solo easter egg and get "disconnected from the Call Of Duty: Black Ops 3 servers" at the final step.

The zombies mode is amazing but unfortunately almost unplayable due to these errors.
short_description: Call of DutyÂ®: Black Ops III Zombies Chronicles Edition includes the full base game plus the Zombies Chronicles content expansion.

name: METAL GEAR SOLID V: THE PHANTOM PAIN
reviews: The phantom pain isn't as immersive as the previous generations and it's a bit monotonous after a while but it does still have the same battle sequences and tactics that you found in the original up to the current title. In the hardest modes of the game, it's game over if you're detected; light, shadow, noise, and obvious seen by the enemy can give off your presence. Enemies chase sound, shadow, and light cues. Be careful with headlights, search lights, and flashlights. They're more dangerous than sound because they can see you far away even when the rain and thunder drowns out weapon report (gunshots). A fantastic gameplay loop of sneaking around, saving wildlife, capturing people, and stealing their stuff to make a nice home for you and your two boyfriends on your lil ocean getaway spot. Its a good game that holds up even 10 years later, though the freakjima stuff is weird
short_description: Ushering in a new era for the METAL GEAR franchise with cutting-edge technology powered by the Fox Engine, METAL GEAR SOLID V: The Phantom Pain, will provide players a first-rate gaming experience as they are offered tactical freedom to carry out open-world missions.

name: Brawlhalla
reviews: Repetitive shit solely maintained to shill cosmetics & passes out for $$$. its very good game and funny to play and its perfect for all ages I curse the creator of this game to eternal hell and torture
short_description: An epic platform fighter for up to 8 players online or local. Try casual free-for-alls, ranked matches, or invite friends to a private room. And it's free! Play cross-platform with millions of players on PlayStation, Xbox, Nintendo Switch, iOS, Android & Steam! Frequent updates. Over sixty Legends.

name: WEBFISHING
reviews:
fish is good, i like fish Massive security risk. Unprotected VOIP multiplayer. Easy-to-mod, easy-to-hack.

[b]!! PLAY AT YOUR OWN RISK !![/b] Great cozy game to play with friends and to show them the smallest or largest fish you caught!
short_description: WEBFISHING a multiplayer chatroom-focused fishing game! Relax and fish (on the web!)

name: Raft
reviews:
Whoever designed the jump puzzle in Utopia deserves a good kick in the butt because the whole thing is so frustrating. I bought the game to build a raft, not to solve overly complicated puzzles and do parkour invented by a Swedish sadist. It's sad that this is NOT MENTIONED anywhere in the description.
 only play if you have friends Fun in general, even better with friends.
short_description: Raftâ„¢ throws you and your friends into an epic oceanic adventure! Alone or together, players battle to survive a perilous voyage across a vast sea! Gather debris, scavenge reefs and build your own floating home, but be wary of the man-eating sharks!

name: ASTRONEER
reviews:
Astroneer to me feels almost exactly like playing with toys, its a really relaxing and enriching experience that is a joy to play with friends, though id imagine playing on your own would be just as enjoyable

The gameplay largely consists on completing missions for your employer EXO, who will have you exploring 8 different planets looking for different materials, creating bases and vehicles, exploring caves and largely doing a lot of busy work, but the busy work in this game is probably the most fun busywork that you'll have in the genre, you also get some cute snails to help you out on your missions.

The crafting is a lot simpler compared to other games too, largely you'll only need like 2-4 nuggets of any materials to craft another item, sometimes you'll also have to synthetize new materials for more advanced recipes, and also gathering atmospheric gasses.

what really makes this game feel right compared to many other crafting and exploration focused games is the way it handles materials and interaction between the player and structures, it works by having little connection points that let you store items on practically anything, attach smaller structures to a platform, put an arm to automate processes and it really gives you a lot of agency with how you interact with crafting stations and lets you automate them in really simple ways, i enjoy it a lot and i'd say it's the best part about the game by far!

something i find notable is the lack of any sort of combat, which i've personally becomed acustomed to in most crafting survival games but, the only real dangers are managing your oxygen reserves and dealing with flora, as theres no fauna to speak of in any planet, while some might find this a deal breaker i actually found the lack of combat made the game a lot more engaging because you don't have to worry about micromanaging a system around it and can spend more time in the parts of the game that it does extremely well.

though its not perfect of course, one mechanic i find somewhat dissapointing is the terraformer tool, its useful as a cave exploration tool for digging and flattening ground and making ramps, but besides that its hard to make anything else besides this with it, theres a few upgrades that let you use it in different ways but it's a bit finnicky, works for its main purpose though.

while there IS a story i was admitedly not paying much attention to the text logs, as its all in text in the form of lost circuit parts, mysterious crystals, and train mission, i think it also deepens a bit in one of the dlcs 

Overall, its a lovingly put together game with support for over 10 years, if you wanna play a less stressful crafting focused game this game is perfect, Highly recommend.



 The animation for digging the role, and chill atmosphere, are great, the graphics runs so well in my pc,

I am always coming back to this game, because i always feel like a kid when i play it, i get fascinated with the new caves, and what could be down there.

I think the graphics are simple but age well, is an old game with still kind of original graphics, it feels unique for me, because the game does not try to be realistic but the graphics are not ugly, they are fun.

It is great game for me. I am playing on ps5 nowadays. best game in the universe
short_description: Interact with strange new worlds in a unique and tactile way, molding the environment itself as if it were clay in your hands. Build your base, master resource management, automate your production lines, and more as you unravel the mysteries of the universe, alone or with friends.

name: Disco Elysium - The Final Cut
reviews:
Some of the most intricate worldbuilding I've ever seen in a game. It's less a video game and more a detailed, interactive comic. The world feels so alive; everyone has something interesting and unique to say, and although some characters *act* a bit like a caricature, they all have hidden depth to them. There are real problems going on in the world around you, and you're able to make a tangible impact. It's very rewarding to help people around you. 

Minor spoilers ahead. 

Disco Elysium maintains an incredible balancing act between sincerity and insanity, between seriousness and comedy, between tension and release. There's even the dichotomyâ„¢ï¸ between the player character's skill as a detective and his helplessness as a human being. He is known by a select number of npcs as the "human can-opener" due to his raw talent in being able to suss out a confession. But despite this, he knows next to nothing about himself.

I cannot overstate how much I enjoyed the story and the characters involved. The player character easily latches onto new and outlandish ideas - for example, you might become fixated with the idea of a legendary boxer, "Contact Mike," you might attempt to seduce a single mother by convincing her that you're *more* of a drunk than her ex, or maybe you'll spend an entire day internally deconstructing an argument presented by a anthropometry-based racist in an effort to outwit him. My point is, these unique options lead you down unexpected paths, revealing the vivacity of the world around you and, personally, really heightening how enjoyable the game is. And best of all, they're incredibly interlinked! None of these weird tangents your character goes off on are ever self-contained. There's always (seemingly) a link between your actions and the overarching story.

At this point in the review, it should be obvious that I recommend playing this game. If you like being immersed in a story, solving puzzles, and especially if you're looking to obsess over a piece of media, then this game is for you.

There wasn't much I disliked about the game. I was definitely left wanting more when I reached the end, but not so much that I'd be willing to instantly jump in for another round. What it lacks in replayability it more than makes up for in memorability though. "In dark times, should the stars also go out?"
Vou levar esse jogo para sempre comigo. funny has good art etcetcetc
short_description: Disco Elysium - The Final Cut is a groundbreaking role playing game. Youâ€™re a detective with a unique skill system at your disposal and a whole city to carve your path across. Interrogate unforgettable characters, crack murders or take bribes. Become a hero or an absolute disaster of a human being.

name: Far CryÂ® 5
reviews: shiz tight good game buss
short_description: Discover the open world of Hope County, Montana, besieged by a fanatical doomsday cult. Dive into the action solo or two-player co-op in the story campaign, use a vast arsenal of weapons and allies, and free Hope County from Joseph Seed and his cult.

name: Plague Inc: Evolved
reviews: Grandfather Nurgle approves play it very fun
short_description: Plague Inc: Evolved is a unique mix of high strategy and terrifyingly realistic simulation. Your pathogen has just infected 'Patient Zero' - now you must bring about the end of human history by evolving a deadly, global Plague whilst adapting against everything humanity can do to defend itself.

name: Stray
reviews: Beautiful and short game that introduces new visuals/puzzles/mechanics in each area. Only wish would be for it to have another couple hours of gameplay. Beautiful artwork, fun gameplay, and emotional story. cat
short_description: Lost, alone and separated from family, a stray cat must untangle an ancient mystery to escape a long-forgotten cybercity and find their way home.

name: Dwarf Fortress
reviews:
I didnt buy Dwarf Fortress. I supported people who have given me hundreds of hours of entertainment since 2009. Losing is fun! And I've been having a lot of it!

This is not the first time I've played it. I've bounced off the 'classic' interface for years without getting very far. There is nothing else like it.
short_description: The deepest, most intricate simulation of a world that's ever been created. The legendary Dwarf Fortress is now on Steam. Build a fortress and try to help your dwarves survive against a deeply generated world.

name: The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion Remastered
reviews: Good game, interesting main story and i also did crusader armor that was epic. didnt do the rest tho but still nice game is fun once i can play for 2 hrs then becomes unplayable due to crashes at the main menu i fixed it by reinstalling 115 gb game over and over until playable this is their first game after all maybe one day they will fix the problems I haven't played the original, nor had I played any other Elder Scrolls game before this, and I believe this to be one of the greatest games I've ever played, due to the sheer amount of quest variety available in the game paired with the ability to determine your own difficulty through individual enemy damage and player damage sliders, allowing me to set enemy damage to Expert, whilst keeping my own on Adept.
short_description: Explore Cyrodiil like never before with stunning new visuals and refined gameplay in The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivionâ„¢ Remastered.

name: Overcooked
reviews:
10/10 me and my friend spent 15 mins on one level because we couldnt stop crying and laughing from the pain. definitely recommend if u want to yell at ur friends Overcooked is the purest form of cooperative chaos Iâ€™ve played: a deceptively simple cooking game that turns into a hilarious, high-pressure teamwork simulator within minutes. The premise is straightforwardâ€”prepare dishes, plate them, and serve them fastâ€”but the way it escalates makes every kitchen feel like a small emergency youâ€™re barely surviving together.

What makes it special is how quickly it forces real communication. You canâ€™t quietly â€œdo your own thingâ€ and expect success; you have to call out orders, coordinate tasks, and constantly adjust when something goes wrong. Itâ€™s not just about quick handsâ€”itâ€™s about shared priorities, timing, and knowing when to abandon a plan and improvise.

The level design is the star. Kitchens arenâ€™t static rooms; they are puzzles in motion, with shifting platforms, splitting trucks, slippery ice, and layouts that actively sabotage your workflow. Each stage introduces a twist that changes how you think about the same basic actions, so the game stays fresh even though the controls remain easy to grasp.

Mechanically, Overcooked is clean and readable, which is crucial because the screen becomes a storm of plates, timers, and half-finished dishes. Chopping, cooking, washing up, and delivering all feel snappy, and the feedback is clear enough that mistakes usually feel like your fault rather than the gameâ€™s. When you pull off a perfect service streak, it genuinely feels earned.

Difficulty ramps in a way thatâ€™s exciting and, at times, brutally honest. A three-star run often demands near-perfect coordination, and the difference between â€œweâ€™re fineâ€ and â€œeverything is on fireâ€ can be about ten seconds. That said, the challenge is also what creates the best momentsâ€”those frantic rescues, clutch deliveries, and synchronized routines that make you feel like an actual kitchen team.

As a social game, itâ€™s outstanding, but it comes with a warning label: it can reveal how people handle stress. With the right group, itâ€™s nonstop laughter and triumphant shouting; with the wrong mix, it can become tense or blamey. Itâ€™s at its best with friends who can communicate, stay flexible, and treat failures as part of the joke.

If you want a co-op game thatâ€™s easy to learn, hard to master, and endlessly entertaining in short bursts, Overcooked is an easy buy. Itâ€™s not about long-term progression or narrativeâ€”itâ€™s about the joy of coordinated panic and the satisfaction of turning disorder into a smooth rhythm. Bring patience, bring a sense of humor, and be ready to yell â€œWHOâ€™S ON DISHES?â€ more than you ever thought possible.

reviews: NICE I am thumbing up this game since it has done nothing wrong but be a game about washing stuff, but goddam its boring to wash stuff sometimes good for focusing on something that isnt negative. even if it looks like a lot to clean, it is nice to go at your own pace without the pressure (heh) of a time limit if youre playing casually. it is also nice to see the progress you make over time. hearing the ding always makes me feel accomplished
short_description: Release the Pressure with PowerWash Simulator! Wash away your worries with the soothing sounds of high-pressure water. Fire up your power washer and blast away every speck of dirt and grime you can find, all with the simple satisfaction of power-washing to a sparkling finish.

name: RimWorld
reviews:
I kidnap tribal villagers for organs,
I sell drug,
I enslave kids,
Then I sit down and play Rim World it a pretty good game. good game i like to kill stuf realy hard Great Game

reviews: Fun open world, solid gunplay, Definitely worth playing. absolute cinema Write a review for Tom Clancy's Ghost ReconÂ® Wildlands

very pretty game
i like

name: Robocraft
reviews:
Tried installing the game twice and nothing it still says error 2323 tried everything, crappy uncompatable game would not recommend! its a great game just takes a little wile to get the good stuff. :) I find it hard to start out without money against other players.  The best is to fight AI at first and gain rewards and weapons.   Once you reach a powerful enough robot then you can join clans and fight in battles.  The more you play, the more you can do.  The rewards are gained faster by head to head in a Clan Battle.

The game is worth it!

name: DISTRAINT: Deluxe Edition
reviews:
peak Great indie game :) Distraint is a pleasant game, with an atmosphere as simple as it is complex. The idea of â€‹â€‹the game is a pleasant one, related to the mental damage that man suffers from the desire to be successful. 
Personally, I enjoyed the game in many ways. A big plus is the short time, easy achievements and simple puzzles (I would have liked something a little more complex, but I accept that too). 
In conclusion, the game is worth playing. You need 2 walkthroughs, at least that's how it was needed for me.
short_description: DISTRAINT is a 2D psychological horror adventure game for PC. In order to secure a partnership in a famous company, Price seizes the property of an elderly woman. In that very moment, he finds out the price of his humanity.

name: STAR WARSâ„¢ Knights of the Old Republicâ„¢ II - The Sith Lordsâ„¢
reviews: its an older game and has its issues sure but still the best star wars rpg on the market to date! Be sure to get the recommended mods for the complete experience. yes
short_description: 5 years after the events of the award winning original, the Sith are on the verge of crushing the Old Republic. As a lone Jedi, will you follow the light side or succumb to the dark?

reviews: A classic fun game really good for its time has a console version so sucks no controller support also boots up with lower graphics and keeps warning u u need at least 2gb of ram and 512 mb of vram to have the higher settings (lol) also needs to have mods bc game doesent expect u to have more than 2 gb of ram which u almost certainly do i mean even a cheap laptop would probaly have atleast 4 to 8 gb so if ur not computer savvy get it on 360 Short and unique, very worth playing

The Red Solstice is a tense, tactical, squad-based action game. Fight to survive with up to 8 players in co-op, or lead your own squad in single-player mode.

name: Warframe
reviews:
:^) this shit hit me like crack hit the 80s

be careful I've played Warframe for over 4,000 hours. I supported the game financially, bought cosmetics, and genuinely enjoyed the grind, the builds, the boss fights, and the community. But over the past 3 years, things have gone seriously downhill.

The devs introduced damage attenuation, a system that basically nerfs your DPS into the ground. Even in this update, there are still 5 viable one-shot builds (one using the Tornado augment), but generally, your 500 million damage build gets reduced to 50,000 against certain bosses. Why? Because they donâ€™t want players one-shotting bosses.

Fineâ€”but if youâ€™re going to prevent us from nuking bosses, at least design bosses that are actually fun to fight. Not these dull bullet sponges with 1.5 predictable attacks and no unique mechanics.
There are great bosses in Warframeâ€”Ropalolyst, Profit-Taker, Exploiter Orb, and Jackal. They have mechanics, phases, movement. But these new ones? Just health bars with legs.

The In-Game Economy Is a Joke Now
In just 2.5 years, Arcane Energize plummeted from 2,000 platinum to around 220. Inflation is bad enough in real lifeâ€”I donâ€™t want to see it in my escape too. Thank you, yearly Jade  update and event,

Theyâ€™ve Killed Entire Activities:
Eidolon Hunting? Dead. (Yes, macros were a problemâ€”but punishing the whole community wasn't the answer.)
Steel Path Disruption? Dead.
Void Cascade? Still alive, but a buggy mess + inflation = nope .

Warframe used to reward farming, improving, optimizing.  None of that really matters now . With damage attenuation, someone using an under-modded weapon can do similar damage to someone who spent hours fine-tuning their gear.

Yes, there are still 4â€“5 one-shot boss-killing builds that work.  Enjoy 4-player squads with random loadouts in Deep Archimedea taking forever to clear a bossâ€”unless you happen to have that one friend with a cheese build to carry the run ( now you have to carry him for another Deep Archimedea  round ).

Instead of balancing or refreshing old content, DE keeps adding trash-tier weapons just to pad the Mastery Rank system. It feels like everything is catered to new players, while veterans are being pushed aside.

I never minded the grind. I liked it. Farming rivens, arcanes, or new skins just to kill things 0.1 seconds fasterâ€”that was the fun. But now? That motivation is gone.
I even built a big clan with an active Discord back in 2023. Now? No one wants to play anymoreâ€”including me.
DE chose to treat their long-time players like this. And Iâ€™ve made my choice too: Iâ€™m done.

name: Ghostwire: Tokyo
reviews: Ghostwire; Tokyo is a hard one, while it has a beautiful world and amazingly cool creature designs it falls slightly behind with a bad story sandwich. The story start off really strong  and then somewhere around the middle it slows down and gets a little boring to pick back up at the end and be a cool ending. however the free DLC included came with a really cool story and a new gamemode that i really enjoyed and had me lock in for another 20 hours. I recommend this game just beware of the story pacing. I loved playing through it, and it wont be the last time. I wanted something to relax, have a good time exploring Tokyo without being bored, and it does that perfectly. The city is an awesome recreation, traversal is fun, as is just walking through the streats which is what I did most of the time. The side quest are either nice but short bits or interesting little stories. It looks perfect, runs without a hitch on my system while being on linux. I played in Japanese with eng. subs, and really liked the VAs too. Just don't expect to be learning super skillful mechanics in some complex fighter game. You can be creative and there are some cool mechanics, but thats mostly for variety, you could probably beat the game never using anything else but the basic attack. I wish I had been told upfront that Ghostwire: Tokyo is a combination of Deus Ex, Hitman, and Assassin's Creed, only set in an awesome contemporary Japan setting. If I had known that, I would have bought and played it upon release. Nevertheless, I'm glad I managed to catch up to it and I can definitely recommend it to anybody who just enjoys playing a damn good game.
short_description: Tokyo's population has vanished, and deadly supernatural forces prowl the streets. Use an arsenal of elemental abilities to unravel the truth behind the disappearance and save Tokyo.

name: STAR WARS Jedi: Survivorâ„¢
reviews:
Fun game, performance wasn't great on 7800xt i712700kf. Had periods where it stuttered, had load in that was extremely visible. Didn't crash from memory. load times were quick enough. Gameplay is fun, somewhat step up from fallen order. Map exploration was... okay? I prefer the design in fallen order. I liked being able to explore and get health upgrades and things like that. the dungeons were cool in this one, but felt like the maps were sparse. love merin x cal. EA came so close to making a good Star Wars soulslike adventure game for the second time in a row. I'm somewhat baffled how so many annoying things from the first game where improved but so many were left unchecked. I'll add a warning before any major spoilers for either this or Fallen Order. 

First of all, to be fair, they made many improvements. The little animations when you find loot or use rest points/workbenches/etc. can eat up a lot of time; they are unnecessary and this game did a good job of shortening them. For example: I don't need a 3-second animation of Cal staring at the lightsaber I was just customizing... I'm going to see it for hours in-game. 

Also, having companions engage in combat and interact with the world is a huge plus. In Fallen Order, they literally just stand around the ship while you do everything. It makes no sense. I'm glad they use the companions well in this game. 

I think the most MAJOR improvement is the perk system. I can't believe this needed to be said, but cosmetic collectibles are POINTLESS. If people enjoy that, great, but there's no sense of pride for me in finding 90 different poncho colors. If I'm spending time looking for stuff, I want it to matter in the game.

On the other hand, that's immediately walked back by the sheer quantity of stuff in this game. Not interactions, not story variations, not anything remotely interesting... just "stuff." Bloat. Nonsense. Time-wasting collectibles and barterable goods that ultimately get you a handful of game-enhancing things, but then... you're shopping for collectibles. And I know I said the animations were shortened, but there are SO MANY MORE. There's a significantly higher quantity of detours and quasi-cutscenes and it all just amounts to "stuff." Go over here, look at this stuff. Go over there, pick up that stuff. Look at that new colorful stuff you got! Hey, check out this fun stuff happening that you can't interact with! Isn't all this STUFF neat?

Except all the "stuff" they packed into this game doesn't change the fact that all you've been doing is scaling walls and jumping on platforms. I keep finding myself asking "where are the fights?" and "where are the puzzles?" and "okay, can we MOVE ON already?" so many times. 

Spoilers for both games ahead:

The main reason I have a critical problem with all the little distractions and cosmetic items in this game is because they are exactly that: distractions. The story is menacingly stupid in how it presents its own premise. Cal wants to find this mysterious hidden world called Tanalorr so that he and his loved ones can escape the Empire and live there in peace. Meanwhile Cal is also wrestling with whether or not he wants to give up fighting the Empire in the first place. 

That's a decent hook if you never watched any Star Wars movies but even then, the whole "Cal isn't sure if he even wants to run away while searching for a world to run away to" aspect needs to be considered. That's like buying a plot of land and hiring a builder to build you a house, and only AFTER do you decide if you want to live there. Okay. Anyway, if he wants to FO and leave the fight, why does anyone need this hidden secret world? Seriously, these writers have never seen Star Wars. 

And now we've arrived at the core issue: other than lightsabers, stormtroopers, and the presence of the Jedi, this game wants nothing to do with Star Wars as a concept. It isn't creatively thinking beyond the established canon, it's just ignoring it. Fallen Order did this to a similar extent... that entire game fixates on the Zeffo, an ancient alien civilization that is not rooted in existing lore and connect to it in any meaningful way. Everything we know about Star Wars and the Jedi is in Column A, and here are the Zeffo in Column B. 

However, that story's redeeming quality is that there is a SIGNIFICANT NEED to care about the Zeffo. One way or another, they were the only ones capable of creating an impervious Force-dependent vault that was used to conceal the names of Force-sensitive children who could rebuild the Jedi. FINE, I can make my peace with that. The list of Force-sensitives is needed, so all this roundabout stuff with the Zeffo is acceptable. 

But in Survivor, the entire premise is just a non-starter. The second Cal and company start talking about their quest to find Tanalorr, I'm immediately reminded that they all forgot they live in the Star Wars universe because the writers don't care about Star Wars, where there are thousands of worlds that are wild and vast and unexplored. Remember in Episode 5 when there was an entire plotline about a Jedi successfully hiding from the Empire until he died of old age? I'm gonna go on a limb and say that Jedi was a bigger target for the Empire than Chad from Malcolm in the Middle AKA Cal Kestis. And what was the name of that other super important Jedi who successfully hid for about 20 years and only revealed himself when he was ready to pass the torch to his apprentice? I'm not saying Dagobah and Tattooine are prime real estate, but those are two top-of-mind examples that don't require special hidden knowledge and a bunch of lore-adjacent stuff that only matters in this one standalone story.

Anyway... overall, my feelings are mixed. This game is definitely fun to play, but I wish they spent development capital and resources on the story and ironing out the 7,000 glitches I've encountered within the first few hours instead of devoting so much energy into all the different loot and collectibles and bartering systems needed to style Cameron Monaghan's hair. 

5/10 Meh.
short_description: The story of Cal Kestis continues in STAR WARS Jedi: Survivorâ„¢, a galaxy-spanning, third-person, action-adventure game.

name: FINAL FANTASY XV WINDOWS EDITION
reviews:
High highs, Low lows. 6.3/10 Awesome game, I am not disappointed. The boyband fighting against huge monsters really sold it tome Lifelong FF fan since FF1, I consider most modern FF's to be disappointing for a very long time but I really thought this one was interesting. I especially thought just the throw/teleport mechanics were at least fun to see. 
Firstly, the game runs like complete shit. Fiddled for most of the 17 hours I have logged just trying to get it to be playable even at 720/30 frames-I fully reject the idea of I should spend thousands to play this game on PC, it's called optimization for crying out loud. So with FSR enabled and everything set to low and at 900/30 it's tolerable outside of battle. Once getting it to be barely playable, it's just plain boring. 4 guys you have no reason to care about on a road trip barely knowing what to do to progress the story. There is more prod in the right direction to complete the main objective in Oblivion or Skyrim. So I'm stuck with a handful of who cares quests, one being getting parts for a sword upgrade from some skank at a gas station. Uninstalling for the dozenth time and this is the last time I'm wasting the install time and disk space. HARD vote for do not waste your money on this junk. Do yourself a favor and stick to Final Fantasy 12 or older (6, 7, 8, 10 and 12 if you ask me-8 being my personal favorite).
short_description: Take the journey, now in ultimate quality. Boasting a wealth of bonus content and supporting ultra high-resolution graphical options and HDR 10, you can now enjoy the beautiful and carefully-crafted experience of FINAL FANTASY XV like never before.

name: The Surge
reviews:
I remember picking this as my first souls-like years ago because of its sci-fi setting. Back then I only lasted around 45 minutes before giving up; the whole genre just seemed far too difficult for me. But now, more than half a decade later and with six souls-likes perfected, I've decided to come back and finish it.

I'm struggling. Badly.

This game is the most brutal and unforgiving of all the souls-likes I've played so far. Blocking is completely useless in this one; if you don't dodge, even the weakest enemy in the game can two-shot you in FULL HEAVY MK.2 ARMOR!!! since I'm a "sit-behind-your-shield" kinda guy this essentially ruins the game for me.

Not sure I can finish this one to be honest, but hey, the story seems awesome and if you like dodging-focused gameplay this one is for you, just make sure you stick with the lynx armor.

SCORE: 7/10. The first hour was kinda fine. But after that, itâ€™s so dark I ainâ€™t seeing nothing. I canâ€™t finish it. Such a game breaker. Light up your game. Definitely fun for Souls like enthusiast. Interesting and relatively novel game mechanics. Cool SF world. Recommended
short_description: Welcome to CREO, the megacorporation saving the world! A catastrophic event has knocked you out during the first day on the jobâ€¦ you wake up equipped with a heavy-grade exoskeleton, in a destroyed section of the complex.

name: Lossless Scaling
reviews:
Made my mass effect playable and made terraria modded silky smooth, looking forward to future updates!, will further experiment what games work best with this, total god send of an application, good stuff. THIS IS ONE OF THE BEST AND MOST MEANINGFUL PURCHASES!

I don't need to say too much, just look at the other reviews.

Without a doubt, you have to spend a little time getting to grips with it and adjusting the settings. 
Check out tutorials and you will understand how it works.

Who wouldn't want to play Cyberpunk 2077 and other performance-hungry titles at over 100+ FPS without upgrading their graphics card?
Here is the solution. 

Ok...well, that's only half the truth, because it's not absolutely perfect - true. And it doesn't replace a good graphics card completely. But for many people and gamers out there this tool could be an absolute game changer - I am such a person who benefits from it. 

My work PC and my notebook are much more powerful than my gaming PC, because I have to make compromises. This tool, together with GeForceNow, fills that gap. I'm not investing much in hardware at the moment until prices stabilise - It's so ridiculous and painful at the same time. 

Back to the topic:
LosslessScaling belongs in the Hall of Fame. 

Buy it and try it out. 
The price is low for what you can achieve with it. I don't normally review software, I bought this on sale along with Doom The Dark Ages. Their stupid ass ray tracing requirement is killing my 6650 XT, was getting 48 fps even on the lowest settings with FSR Balanced. Built in FSR frame gen did absolutely nothing. I realized I went and bought Lossless Scaling too, so I tried it out. Holy hell guys, this software is absolutely incredible. Fixed setting was EXTREMELY noticeable, with frame gen was getting 60 to 80fps. I was expecting the input lag to be bad but honestly, it's not that bad. Surprisingly playable! Even if a little noticeable. I then tried the adaptive setting which performed MUCH better and cut back on the input lag a bit too. 


I don't believe in conspiracies, but I genuinely believe this method of frame gen is purposely being held back by AMD and Nvidia simply to sell more GPUs. Yes, it's not a perfect technology but this program outclasses their methods by a wide margin.

In conclusion, best $4.89 I ever spent. 10/10 program. MUST BUY if you have an older GPU struggling and you don't mind very minor, but playable input lag. I can not give enough credit to the developers, this isn't magic by any means but it is the closest to "free performance" I have ever seen.
short_description: All-in-one gaming utility for frame generation and scaling

name: Alan Wake
reviews:
Even for a game that came out over 10 years ago, this game is rough to play. If you are playing this for background info for the Control DLC or Alan Wake II, just watch a video or something. The controls are floaty and bad. The combat SUUUUUUCKS. It's not hard, it's not fun, it's tedious. Hold right click on an enemy until it pops and then shoot it 2-6 times depending on difficulty level. Difficulty just changes how many times you have to click on an enemy. I got about half way through the game and there was only ever 2 types of enemy, a guy that takes 2 hits, and a guy that takes 4 hits.

The only difficulty to the game comes from the enemies swarming you and the fact that you can't do anything to them until you put light on them for long enough. The camera control is bad, and it is made worse by the fact that the game twirls the camera around the area *every* time an enemy spawns in. You walk into an area, it's clearly going to be a place where enemies will come in, and then the camera twirls around to show off that enemies have spawned.

The story is kind of interesting but the gameplay is abhorrent. I'm not judging this based on how games are in 2025, there are plenty of games that came out before this one that have much better gameplay. This is just bad. Cinema ÙƒÙ…ÙŠØ© Ø¯Ø¦Ø« Ùˆ Ø¯Ù†Ø«
short_description: A Dark Presence stalks the small town of Bright Falls, pushing Alan Wake to the brink of sanity in his fight to unravel the mystery and save his love.

name: Dungeon Defenders II
reviews:
definitely worse than Dungeon Defenders I & has DLC in the price range up to 97,50â‚¬. Not recommendable This game has SO MANY SYSTEMS that you end up spending more time trying to understand and study all the features than actually playing.
And the devs donâ€™t make it easy â€” not for new players, and not even for returning veterans trying to catch up.

I stopped playing when I realized that the game, which used to have 5 or 6 core mechanics to enjoy and grind for, now has like 80 new systems, 115 weapon add-ons, 40 categories of wearables, and 38 other things (which Iâ€™ll just call â€œsystemsâ€).

And the worst part? The devs donâ€™t explain any of it.
How do you get these things? Where do you find them? Why should you care? Do I even need them? Should I farm for them? Is it worth the effort? None of it is clear. So... why bother?

Then when I do get something new â€” a relic, emblem, ring, chain, stone, prism, etc. etc. â€” I have no idea what to do with it.
Is it for a weapon? For a tower?
Oh! Apparently I can upgrade it... if I combine it with 13 new craftable materials Iâ€™ve never heard of.

I mean, the game has just become way too complicated and confusing.
And then, boom â€” new update:
"Now you have a chance to get this new 'thing-you-have-no-idea-what-it-does' to help on your adventures! Good luck!"

Why? Just... why?
Itâ€™s all so poorly explained, and it's such a shame â€” because this game used to be FANTASTIC. Devs have taken a turn for the worse just leaving a once staple in the TDD genre to die and are releasing half baked products over and over just to make a quick buck.
short_description: Dungeon Defenders II is a cooperative Action Tower Defense game packed with roleplaying elements like loot, leveling, and pets.

reviews:

The game by todays standards has alot of flaws and missing many features that makes the sequals so good. But its where it all started.

HOWEVER! The 100 days 'cheve taking almost 7 HOURS is not okay man...

name: Borderlands 3
reviews:
Every step of the way, along the main storyline, the two plot armored thieves watch from above with godlike omnipresence, swooping in from planet to planet knowing EXACTLY what the player is doing the whole time, and not for one second does anyone wonder "how are they tracking us? whats going on?"  and to make matters worse, every single time the vault hunter DOES get a chance to fight the twins they get COMPLETELY BODIED, its barely a fight, and yet noone has the good sense to put a bullet in the back of their skulls to make sure they dont get back up and screw us all over (as it happens about 5 times through the game). If lilith were a real person she would have throat cut them the first time they go down after they "beat" her.  The first time, maybe that could happen, carelessness happens once maybe, though my vault hunter reached lilith in a MUCH shorter time than the cutscene ran for because I wanted to back her up or at least try to and blasted my way to her quickly, but AFTER Lilith, After MAYA, AFTER FRIGGIN TANNIS it. is. personal.  The player will HATE them with every fiber of their being, and yet.... cutscenes will ALWAYS protect the twins from any real harm.  It's just bad writing, the makers of this game are complete hacks, and do not deserve your money.  If they wanted to force the player to lose by making the twins uber powerful THAT might have been acceptable, at least you lose fairly, but defeat by cutscene just FEELS wrong every time it happens.  It takes away all player agency and makes this a poorly written book, not a game.  I hope whatever lead writer was responsible for this never makes another game. 
 Buy BL4, its actually fairly decent, but do not pay for 3......ever.  It isnt even worth 5 bucks.  Take note, I don't hate this because I hate the characters, evil characters can be hated and that can be fine, but the important thing is that you get to go after them, win or lose, and not feel like god has reached down and said "nu uh bro, you cant try to fight em, you're just gonna sit and watch while all this happens" and basically every time its done in a way that the character would NOT just be sitting and watching, no real person would.  Do better gearbox.  Well... you did anyhow, on 4.  Much less of this. game sucks some crazy ass Fuckass crash mid arcade game bro
short_description: The original shooter-looter returns, packing bazillions of guns and a mayhem-fueled adventure! Blast through new worlds and enemies as one of four new Vault Hunters.

name: Hacknet
reviews: Best hacking game of all time! Highly realistic Unix commands, engaging puzzles, and total freedom to break anything you want. 10/10 gg à¹€à¸­à¸²à¹„à¸› 10 à¸„à¸°à¹à¸™à¸™à¹€à¸•à¹‡à¸¡ à¹„à¸¡à¹ˆà¸¡à¸µà¸„à¸§à¸²à¸¡à¸™à¹ˆà¸²à¹€à¸šà¸·à¹ˆà¸­à¸ˆà¸³à¹€à¸ˆà¹€à¸«à¸¡à¸·à¸­à¸™à¹€à¸à¸¡à¸‹à¸´à¸¡à¸¹à¹€à¸¥à¹€à¸•à¸­à¸­à¸·à¹ˆà¸™à¹† à¹à¸•à¹ˆà¸šà¸²à¸‡à¸”à¹ˆà¸²à¸™à¸à¹‡à¸¢à¸²à¸à¹€à¸à¸´à¸™ à¹à¸–à¸¡à¹„à¸¡à¹ˆà¸¡à¸µà¹ƒà¸šà¹‰à¸”à¹‰à¸§à¸¢à¸•à¸´à¸”à¸¡à¸²2 à¹€à¸”à¸·à¸­à¸™à¸¥à¸°à¸”à¹ˆà¸²à¸™à¸™à¸µà¹‰
short_description: Hacknet is an immersive, terminal-based hacking simulator for PC. Dive down a rabbit hoIe as you follow the instructions of a recently deceased hacker, whose death may not have been the accident the media reports.

name: Orcs Must Die!
reviews:
Yes I really enjoy making orcs not exist :) Great game, everything from movement to the enemy ai and placing traps. Only minor complaint i have is that the individual levels are a bit short, they end just as you are turning the tide in your favor. witch is fitting with the games story, but robbs you of the good part of sitting back and doing nothing while orcs dies to your traps [h1] Overview [/h1]
Really fun blend of tower defence and third person shooter. I've had the sequel forever but never got around to playing it, figured I'd start with the first game after hearing it was single player only. The game shines on the higher difficulties where you have to make the best use of different traps and abilities, though I certainly had my favourites. It does feature very quippy marvel-esque humour which was fresh for the time it came out, but may not be as enjoyable for you now. 

[h1] Steam Deck [/h1]
I played 100% on Steam Deck and had no issues. Controller isn't as precise as mouse + keyboard when it comes to shooting (headshots are really important) but I usually chose my build to focus on traps and guardians instead to mitigate that. 

[h1] Achievements [/h1]
Some will unlock just playing the game normally, but a lot require you to use specific traps in specific scenarios, or even no traps at all. Going for the achievements made me try a lot of things I may not have used otherwise, which is perfect for a game like this. 

The difficulty based achievements are in a bit of a weird balance. There are three difficulties: Apprentice, War Mage, and Nightmare, and while Nightmare is certainly the hardest, I actually had more problems in War Mage. There is an achievement that requires you to 5-star all the levels on War Mage, which requires you to never die, your core to take 0 damage, and to finish within a strict time limit. 

Nightmare, while far more difficult to complete, doesn't require you to 5-star anything, just to complete it. I completed some of the Nightmare levels very sloppily and still got past, where trying to 5-star the same level on War Mage could get sweaty. Not a complaint necessarily, and 5-starring everything on War Mage was great training for doing Nightmare in that regard, just an odd achievement difficulty balance without a similar achievement to 5-star Nightmare.
short_description: Slice them, burn them, skewer them, and launch them - no matter how you get it done, orcs must die in this fantasy action-strategy game from Robot Entertainment.

name: S.T.A.L.K.E.R. 2: Heart of Chornobyl
reviews:
awesome atmosphere and gameplay but i feel like if i shoot a guy with a 12 ga buckshot from within 10 yards he should be on the ground incapacitated regardless I'm not sure how to describe it but the controls just feel awful. The old Stalker games feel much more snappy and precise in comparison. The aiming for some reason just feels incredibly slippery and choppy. I honestly can't recommend this game for that reason alone. It's unfortunate because I really wanted to enjoy this game. Great game, actually feels like the old games after their latest improvements. AI are almost as smart as they were in the old games which is great and it seems to be getting better with subsequent updates. On higher difficulties you don't see enemies just getting more and more health like other games. They get better gear, are more accurate, employ more technique.

It seems like there are more mutants on higher difficulties as I will find clusters of burners in some areas. I fought off 15 of them and spent way too much money doing it. Snorks galore... So, picking your battles is very important like previous games. 

My only problem is the fluctuating performance at times. 

Still STALKER is one of the few games I can really lose track of time playing which rarely occurs with games.

name: Total War: SHOGUN 2
reviews:
Was enjoying the empire builder and strategy aspects of the game as a first time Total War player. The vanilla game is very shallow in depth for units types and strategies. Spends way too much time coin and effort just stopping your already conquered fities from rebelling. God forbid a player spend any time expanding. Two turns in the red is all it take for your home city to rebel....what?

The game ender was the Realm Divide feature. You finally fight through all the malarky the take the Capital, grow an economy and army, and then all the AI clans gang up on you, even the game long allies. There no way to fight all of them at ounce. Its unavoidable, pre-programed game design. why?????

Uninstalled to the trash bin.

 Honestly my favorite total war game. In my opinion way better than medieval 2. Really fun, easy to understand, and the battles are great. However i didnt really like how limited the amount of playable factions there are. Still though the greats outweight the negatives. Glorious in 2025
short_description: Total War: SHOGUN 2 is the perfect mix of real-time and turn-based strategy gaming for newcomers and veterans alike.

name: Enshrouded
reviews:
I put maybe 150 hours into this game about a year ago. Feeling satisfied i'd done everything I wanted to do, I stopped, saw updates were regular and said I'd come back in about a year and try it again figuring out I'd miss 3-4 major updates and that at the time long-term players loved that it'd gotten so much over a year.

And then I came back and I put in the remaining hours. There is no 'but''. I did miss 3-4 major updates and it feels refreshing as much as people said a year ago.

It's a lot like Valheim. It's got that BOTW stamina and glider system you see in a lot of things nowadays, as well as BOTW style towers, and a bunch of biomes with corrupted timebombey areas in between. Combat is more like Palworld - fairly simple actions. You can play it like Dark Souls if you want, if you use a greatsword it allows you to stagger things while having to watch timing, at least in theory (in reality, if you just break combo after 2 hits, you can move and hit again with minimal risk). Base building is a little like Valheim, more like a 3D Terraria, voxel-based. It does this pretty smoothly, I've only got a 2060 SUPER and while I have it on lower settings, I'm quite happy with how it looks at 60fps.

If you've got an itch for a game like this, this should be pretty high on your list. This game is amazing. The inventory management could use some work and the female characters are fugly, but beyond that I am super impressed so far. 107 hours currently and I've only scratched the surface.
short_description: You are Flameborn, last ember of hope of a dying race. Awaken, survive the terror of a corrupting fog, and reclaim the lost beauty of your kingdom. name: Jack Orlando: Director's Cut
reviews:
Jack Orlando: Directorâ€™s Cut, developed by Toontraxx Studios and published by Topware Interactive, is a vintage point-and-click adventure that exudes the smoky atmosphere and moral ambiguity of a classic 1930s noir. Set in a world of crime, corruption, and forgotten heroes, it follows the titular private detective, Jack Orlandoâ€”a down-on-his-luck investigator framed for murderâ€”through a desperate forty-eight-hour search to clear his name. The game seeks to channel the style of golden-age Hollywood detective films, and while it certainly captures the eraâ€™s visual flair and tone, it also inherits the uneven design sensibilities of its time, resulting in a fascinating yet deeply flawed experience.

From the very beginning, the gameâ€™s atmosphere is unmistakably its strongest asset. The art direction is richly detailed, with every frame painstakingly hand-drawn and painted to evoke the gritty charm of Depression-era America. The streets are lined with flickering neon signs, grimy alleyways, and dimly lit bars that set the perfect stage for a noir mystery. Complementing this visual design is a superb jazz-infused score by Harold Faltermeyer, the composer best known for the â€œBeverly Hills Copâ€ theme, whose work gives the game an unmistakable cinematic texture. The soundscape and art direction succeed in immersing the player in a world that feels both melancholy and aliveâ€”one that could easily have been the setting of a Humphrey Bogart film.

Unfortunately, while the gameâ€™s style and setting are excellent, the substance of its gameplay struggles to meet the same standard. Jack Orlando is built on the classic adventure formula: you explore environments, collect items, and solve puzzles that lead you closer to unraveling the central conspiracy. The problem lies in the logicâ€”or lack thereofâ€”behind many of its puzzles. Solutions often require leaps of reasoning that border on the absurd, forcing players to combine unrelated items or revisit obscure locations for reasons that make little narrative sense. Some puzzles are structured in ways that make failure possible, even permanent, meaning you can easily lock yourself out of progress without realizing it. This kind of design, common in 1990s adventure titles, demands persistence and trial-and-error patience, but today it feels frustratingly opaque.

The narrative itself has all the ingredients for a compelling noir mysteryâ€”a cynical detective, double-crosses, and a city full of suspectsâ€”but the storytelling falters in execution. The writing lacks the sharpness and wit expected from a noir tale, and the dialogue often feels clumsy or awkwardly translated. The English localization, in particular, suffers from uneven phrasing and stilted voice acting that frequently undercuts dramatic moments. While Jack himself has the right weary tone for a washed-up detective, many supporting characters come across as flat caricatures rather than complex personalities. The pacing, too, can drag, with long stretches of aimless wandering between static backgrounds that offer little narrative payoff. Itâ€™s a game that relies heavily on its mood to carry you through the rougher momentsâ€”and while that atmosphere works, it can only do so much to compensate for the lack of storytelling cohesion.

The Directorâ€™s Cut edition, released years after the original, sought to improve upon these flaws by adding new scenes, rebalanced puzzles, and a more streamlined experience. Itâ€™s a welcome effort, but even with these updates, the game still feels like a product of its time. The improvements make the pacing slightly more tolerable and remove some of the most illogical dead ends, yet the core mechanics and design philosophy remain stubbornly old-fashioned. Still, for players who appreciate vintage adventure design, thereâ€™s a certain charm in its rough edges. Its slow pace and methodical investigation style can be immersive if approached with the right mindsetâ€”one that values ambiance over convenience.

In terms of technical performance, the Steam version runs well on modern systems, though it retains the low-resolution visuals and 4:3 aspect ratio of its 1990s origins. Its age shows, but thereâ€™s something appealing about its pixel-perfect backgrounds and painterly environments that modern remasters often lose in translation. The user interface, while simple, can be unintuitive, especially when dealing with the gameâ€™s inventory system, which lacks modern conveniences like item highlights or contextual hints. These limitations, however, are part of the retro charm for players accustomed to classic adventure quirks.

Ultimately, Jack Orlando: Directorâ€™s Cut is a game that fascinates as much as it frustrates. Itâ€™s a richly atmospheric journey through a world of corruption and melancholy, anchored by beautiful visuals and a phenomenal soundtrack. But itâ€™s also bogged down by archaic design choices, awkward dialogue, and uneven pacing that can test even the most patient of players. Itâ€™s a relic of a bygone era of adventure gamingâ€”an ambitious, moody experiment that captures the feel of noir storytelling better than it executes it. For enthusiasts of classic point-and-click adventures or fans of noir aesthetics, it remains a curio worth experiencing for its artistry and tone. For others, it serves as a reminder of how far adventure games have evolved since the days when style and frustration often walked hand in hand.

Rating: 6/10 good point and click detective game [h2]Jack Orlando: Director's Cut[/h2]

Contra:
- unglaublich viele Bugs. Laut steam- und Redditcommunity wird an dem Game nicht mer gearbeitet, bzw nur sehr fade. Was ich sehr schade finde.
- klettern ist so nervig. Man benÃ¶tigt es zwar fÃ¼r 90% der map um Ã¼berall hin zu kommen, jedoch klettert man oft ungewollt an bÃ¤umen oder sogar an Gegner rum, was sehr nervig ist.
- sehr wenig graphic settings 
- movement sehr clunky. Bin leider einer der wenigen auserwÃ¤hlten, die den movement bug haben, bei dem mein Charakter nach dem loslassen der Sprinttase fÃ¼r ne halbe Sekunde stehen bleibt. Laut Com. nichts zu machen. Ist Sache der Devs, das zu fixen
- trotz sehr schÃ¶ner und ausgeprÃ¤gter Map und Welt ist doch sehr viel â€žLuftâ€œ dazwischen. Man rennt und rennt und bis auf ein paar kleine Kisten und Pflanzen gibtâ€™s nichts zu holen. Etwas fade.
- Caves sind alle gleich, bis auf das Ende der Cave. Keine varianz drin leider.
