Und grÃ¶ÃŸter negativer Punkt: wie schon oben genannt, arbeiten die Devs kaum noch an dem Spiel, was unglaublich schade ist. Es is ein Meisterwerk und kÃ¶nnte, wenn mal alles gefixt wird, jedes Open-World-Craft-Adventure Game um LÃ¤ngen Ã¼berholen. Allein durch die Vielfalt, was man hier alles machen kann. 


Alles in allem wÃ¼rde ich eine 8/10 geben, wenn man mal die bugs weglÃ¤sst. Diese ziehen das Spielerlebnis doch oft sehr runter. 
WÃ¼rde es trotzdem jedem aus dieser Genre ans Herz legen. Ihr werdet viel SpaÃŸ haben. 
 I'm calling this game a definite love letter and one up. It's in early access, has some flaws, and needs work, but I am having a ball. There is already plenty to do and practice up on while this game is tinkered with by the developer. Sure, Palworld is taking up a lion's share of priority, but Palword exploded when it came out and is every bit as good as the hype claims. These two games fill in all the missed opportunities and potential for the games they pay homage to. If you have a clear understanding of what 'Early Access' entails, and can play games, that lead you a little bit, but not by the nose. You will have a lot of fun with this game. Do understand that a lot of the dialogue is poorly translated, but again, welcome to early access. These things will get ironed out in the moments when the devs are able to come up for air working on the game that is paying bills and putting food on their families tables. Where I got bored in that 'other game', this is far from. I am having an incredible amount of fun after getting passed some of rough around the edges parts in the beginning moments of the game, but reminded myself that it is all par per course, when it comes to eatly access, and I seen games in early access for longer than this as well. I saw this game called, 'The Best Bad Game'. Its not a bad game, its just in early access, where it should be. And its too much fun to be called bad. We need more people to add their positive reviews, in spite of all the other run of mill, negative nancy reviews you tend to see carbon copied everywhere. Is every going to like this game? No. Should it get a fair shake? Yes. I cannot think of many games that everyone likes. This one is no different, but give it a chance and don't immediately shut down as some negative reviews will have trained you to and you just might find yourself in my shoes: having fun and appreciating the scope of this game and also the importance of this game and its little brother. You can't have your cake and eat it too, 'other gaming company', There are other talented studios out there that are going give you a run for your money and provide the masses with great games, This one just has a way yet to yet, but as I said, fair critiques, helpful feedback, will keep the dev in the game and not feel overwhelmed, which they surely are. Another thing, maybe just my luck, but no crashes thus far. Im playing on PC and Steam Deck. I'm sure the gremlins will try and crop up, but so fat nada, and that's with plenty going on on screen. If you play on  
Steam Deck, choose the 1280 (I think) reso. The default is too wide. Have Fun! Great co-op game with a stylistically reminiscent of the Legend of Zelda.

name: The First Berserker: Khazan
reviews:
good game only 10 hours in and im pretty impressed so far with the everything. 

the gameplay is top notch like a Devil May Cry or Ninja Gaiden meets dark souls but with an anime underworld theme. you feel powerful like if you just hone your knowledge and reaction time you could beat a boss with non stop aggression, you dont get that "taking turns" feeling like in a fromsoftware title and if you do its cause you arent playing as optimally as you could be.

if you want more mechanically demanding fromsoftware game with better combat this is it; although it does lack a little in atmosphere and map design by comparison.

 This game is phenomenal. Around the 40 hour mark I started to feel a bit of burnout, but once everything came together near the end, I was fully reinvigorated and even went back to finish the side content I had skipped. Finding out there are multiple endings added a lot of weight to the experience, and the storyâ€™s climax is top tier. I am really glad I gave this game a chance.

The gameplay is the best I have experienced in any soulslike. I ran dual wield the entire time and never touched the two hander or spear. The speed, the visceral flow of abilities, and the freedom to weave light and heavy attacks felt incredible. Most of the time the game offers a clear path forward with minimal backtracking, although a few areas look similar enough that I briefly got turned around.

Boss fights are consistently excellent and very satisfying. Side quests were enjoyable, but they contributed to my mid game burnout. They reminded me of Niohâ€™s optional missions where you revisit familiar areas with small changes. I liked encountering elite enemies, but I wish there were more variants. Eventually, non boss encounters started to feel repetitive.

The skill and gear systems strike a great balance. They are deep enough for min maxing but never overwhelming. Think Diablo 3 or Torchlight, accessible and rewarding without needing a spreadsheet.

Overall, the game is absolutely worth the price. Near the end I worried it might lean more toward quantity than quality, but I was wrong. The payoff was worth it, and the journey was memorable from start to finish
short_description: The First Berserker: Khazan is a hardcore action role-playing game. The player will become Khazan, the great general of the Pell Los Empire, who overcame death, and sets out to reveal the incidents that led to his downfall and seek vengeance on his enemies.

Strongly recommend for Gothic (and in general RPG) fans...

Players utilize Karmas (the method used to indicate weapon and class types) when charging into battle. Each character gets to use two types of Karmas.

infinite replay value love it  but i payed fot the kings tombs dlc and steam didnt added it in to my libraby so i oayed foir nothing >randomly appears in my library

name: Hitman 2: Silent Assassin
reviews:
This game doesnt work on steam without outside sources, you might have a better chance using the gog version, cool game though! Still an amazing game, very engaging, I like the difficulty levels and the rankings. I keep coming back to it every after a while 
The game is good, but it causes a lot of problems when you install it. To fix this, you have to install a third-party setup, and then it works properly.
short_description: Enter the realm of a retired assassin, forced back into action by treason. You may be a hired killer but you still have a sense of loyalty and justice. Visit the dark recesses of a world corrupted by crime, greed, degradation and dishonor. And a past that catches up with you.

name: Stories: The Path of Destinies
reviews:
Worth playing, fun combat and unlocks as you slowly unravel the true path of the story, by dying lot's and lot's of times.
And the characters are well written, Narator is well voiced too. Unfortunate to say having bought this game years ago and looking forward to playing it, now that I have it's an immediate put-off. An annoying narrator with some oddly amateur writing, painfully saturated imbalanced visuals and boring gameplay. The illustrations of the characters are cute, but that is about all it has. holds up as a unique gem in 2025.
short_description: Stories: The Path of Destinies is an Action RPG, an enchanted storybook filled with madcap fantasy tales, each told by a zippy narrator attuned to the playerâ€™s choices and actions.

name: Awesomenauts
reviews: thanks devs for fixing the frame rate on steam deck I was stuck at around 44 and now Iâ€™m getting over 140 â€œdockedâ€ keep up the good work. amazing 2d competitive moba. art style is great, retro alien theme is excellent and the characters are easy to get the hang of and hard to master.  BUY this game if you haven't! Its been kicking for like 20 years by now or something.  It was the first ever game i bought on Steam. Played this game as a kid on the PS3, Played it as a teen on PC, and now I'm back again. all around a great game that unfortunately fizzled out over the course of its 13 year existence. As of now the game is pretty much dead, but you can still queue and get a match. I hope that one day a successor to Awesomenauts is made.
short_description: Use your power, show your might! Play this Multiplayer Online Battle Arena (MOBA) game! AWESOMENAUTS combines 2D platforming with team-based strategy and hero based action. Whether you are a new recruit or an intergalactic legend, play AWESOMENAUTS!

But the rest of the games are a bore and a chore to read memos and text in game. so its my suggestion to only play mass effect 1 and mass effect 2 only.

name: GTFO
reviews:
gtfo this is the best coop game i've years, i still get chills just from the intro sequence

the grueling, 2-4 hour missions where a single mistakes ends it all has no equal

the atmosphere is great, still gets on your nerves after many many hours.

sound design is insanely good

gun balance could use a few touchups, but thats about it



 Playing this with friends is both rage-inducing and the most fun I've ever had. Incredibly fulfilling to complete levels with much difficulty.

This new chapter in the Call of DutyÂ® franchise features a new dynamic where players are on the side of a crippled nation fighting not for freedom, or liberty, but simply to...

name: Splitgate
reviews:
It has been a long time since I last played this game. I got so distracted with others over the years that I did not get back to this until just today when I saw that the servers are shutting down as I type this. Yet I am so happy somehow because the developers adopted peer-to-peer networking to enable this game, supposedly and online-only game, to live on without needing a centralized server. Better yet, the anti-cheat is now disabled. This means I might get a chance to play this game on Linux! I haven't played this game on Linux yet because I have only been on Linux for the past few months while the last time I played this game was years ago. I wonder how many other penguins are out there playing this right now.

Companies like 1047 Games will be remembered for demonstrating how absolutely shortsighted some of their competitors are. Funny enough, this move might actually encourage players to try out Splitgate 2 knowing there is now a very good chance that these titles will be well preserved even if the servers shut down. 1047 may have inadvertently solidified a loyal player base. Just... please don't squander it. This is as if halo and portal had a baby. Set in an unreal tournament fighting arena. Super fun even though its all PVP and you cant do offline and fight bots but still fun none the less. Amazing game and community that never deserved to lose its player base.
short_description: Splitgate is a free-to-play, fast-paced multiplayer shooter that features player-controlled portals. This sci-fi shooter takes the FPS genre to a new dimension with its portal mechanics, delivering high-flying, multi-dimensional combat.

name: Gray Zone Warfare
reviews: AI can be super human sometimes and at other times they can be oblivious. Great game though!  I like it better than Escape From Tarkov. Much, much better. It's more forgiving with the same intensity. I was sceptical when it first came out, but I am glad I did end up picking it up as I've had a blast with it.  People are great in game too (PVE). At the 500 hour mark, what now? Now.... we play, 2 shots your done even one can do it, find it to easy like me? run don't stop just keep going. cover? never heard of it. from easy patrols to pushing fort narith with a mp5. I will support this game till the end of time. confusion, warfare, chaos and lots of fun,if you have experience in shooters and like to be tactical and not rushing in this is your game. Get a squad and play this
short_description: Gray Zone Warfare is a tactical sandbox extraction FPS that elevates the genre with a persistent open world set in a Southeast Asian jungle. Join a Private Military Company deployed after a mysterious Event and survive high-stakes PvEvP or PvE operations to take control and uncover the truth.

name: Defy Gravity Extended
reviews:
[h3] ðŸ† Review Title

Defy Gravity Extended â€“ A Simple Arcade Game with Addictive Challenge [/h3]

[code] [quote=Wendrex] ðŸš€ Introduction

Defy Gravity Extended, developed by Paul Fisch, is a great example of how a simple concept can deliver a highly engaging experience. What starts as a minimalist arcade game quickly turns into a tense, challenging, and deeply rewarding journey that keeps you coming back for more.

â­ Gameplay Highlights

The gameplay is tight, responsive, and extremely well-polished. Controlling the ship feels precise, allowing players to focus entirely on navigating dangerous levels filled with hazards and split-second decisions.

Each stage pushes your reflexes and timing, encouraging improvement through repetition rather than frustration. Level design stays fresh and cleverly escalates the challenge without feeling unfair.

ðŸŽ¨ Graphics, Soundtrack & Immersion

Visually, the game embraces a clean and minimalist art style that perfectly suits its arcade nature. Visual clarity is excellent, which is crucial during high-speed moments.

The soundtrack enhances immersion by maintaining tension and focus, supporting the gameplay rather than overpowering it.

ðŸ”¥ Difficulty & Learning Curve

The learning curve is fair but demanding. The controls are easy to understand, yet true mastery requires precision, patience, and practice.

Difficulty increases steadily, making each completed level feel genuinely earned and satisfying.

ðŸŽ¯ What Makes It Fun and Addictive

Fast and responsive gameplay

Short levels that encourage repeated attempts

Strong sense of personal improvement

Skill-based challenge instead of luck

These elements combine to make Defy Gravity Extended highly addictive and perfect for both short play sessions and longer runs.

âœ… Final Verdict

Defy Gravity Extended is an excellent choice for fans of challenging arcade games focused on skill and precision. Itâ€™s simple, fair, and incredibly fun â€” a game that proves great design doesnâ€™t need complexity.

â­ Highly recommended! [/quote] [/code] i mean it's chill, but it's doesnt do anything amazingly, but its not gonna piss you off a heap Nice side scrolling arcade game to play few hours.Could be bought on discount under 50 cent.
short_description: Defy Gravity is an action platformer that is a mix between classic platforming and gravity based puzzle solving.

name: Alien: Isolation
reviews:
an Amazing stealth horror that overstays its welcome.

Halfway through my playthrough even when having fun, I was like â€œwhen does this game end broâ€, itâ€™s certainly too long for what it is and thatâ€™s my biggest grip, the pacing is very inconsistent and some objectives feels unnecessary for the plot and are just there to add more playtime. I feel like if it was about 8 - 10 hours long It wouldâ€™ve been alot better and much more replayable.

Aside from its length, i like this game. The story is good, nothing crazy but itâ€™s interesting enough to go through it, Filed with cool characters that are fleshed out just enough to serve a purpose.

The gameplay is okay, the combat is fine but theyâ€™re both not top tier, so donâ€™t come in expecting something like resident evil 4, it plays a lot more like outlast but far deeper and more engaging, rather than just running away, expect to shoot a few people (or aliens and killing machines) along the way, youâ€™re not completely hopeless but you would feel like it throughout the entire game.

The puzzles are another weak point, theyâ€™re far too simple and can be solved by putting the least amount of effort into it. Did they honestly think pulling down levers and some QTEâ€™s was good enough to be considered a puzzle? Itâ€™s not an issue but it would be nice to do something that requires me to use my high iq Harvard brain (lie) sometimes. 

By far the biggest standout is the stalker enemy, the xenomorph did not disappoint in any way, I anticipated him to be the next Mr X and he absolutely was. The game shines whenever heâ€™s around, the constant feeling that heâ€™s behind you and the way he hears and punishes any noise you make truly makes him one of the best stalkers ever, he will not let you go, heâ€™ll search the whole ship and every hiding spot just to kill you.

Itâ€™s not just the stalker thatâ€™s unique, the joes serve their purpose to the fullest, making you feel hopeless knowing that you canâ€™t kill them unless you empty your revolver. The game encourages you to run away and it executed this tactic in a way that feels entertaining rather than making me feel fatigued.

Overall alien isolation is a good game that wouldâ€™ve been much better if it wasnâ€™t as long as it is, all of its other flaws would be negligible if it wasnâ€™t for that but the cheer scope of it is what makes these issues standout. 7.25/10, get it on a discount. https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3442476751 https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3442476802 it's cool but i get extremely nauseated playing it. i have turned off motion blur and lowered my sensitivity. idk whats causing it
short_description: Discover the true meaning of fear in Alien: Isolation, a survival horror set in an atmosphere of constant dread and mortal danger.

name: Hogwarts Legacy
reviews:
This is a good game, very entertaining, and I'm not even a Potthead. If you are a fan of the Universe then this is a proper banger.

8.5/10 very fun and not too fast paced It does everything I wished the PS2 Harry Potter And The Chamber Of Secrets game should have had but couldn't do to hardware limitations and such when I was was a snot nosed little bitch. The only flaw is why would I want a Dobby clone for a man servant? Why couldn't JK Rowling keep elves as the estrogen filled femboys as they were in everything else instead of making them look like inbred offspring of goblins? The goblins have more hair and better appearances than the meth head elves which raises more questions than answers. Ohh and I had to download a deeper voice mod for my "questionable" "male" character so my T levels didn't drop every time I heard his voice so fair warned. Happy Christmas!!
short_description: Hogwarts Legacy is an immersive, open-world action RPG. Now you can take control of the action and be at the center of your own adventure in the wizarding world.

name: Gunfire Reborn
reviews:
This game is great and my only real critiques are that the translation is a little messy sometimes, the loot explosions after a boss feel visually underwhelming, and I wish there was an alternate stage for each level. 
Now that the minor gripes are out of the way, the gunplay and RPGification of it is great and it's basically what borderlands SHOULD be, and even though there's only a few different types of enemy per each stage there's always enough of each type thrown in for the encounters to feel challenging and fresh each time. Modifiers on enemies feel way better than diablo (and most ARPGs with enemy mofifiers) and the gun variety isn't overwhelming but always feels fresh.
TLDR; underwhelming lack of level variety and a kinda bad translation but if you like rougelite character skill based looter shooters or ARPGs you can play with friends this is a MUST have, it's everything borderlands wishes its base gameplay was and more. a very nice and challenging game that i recommend a lot ! + if you want to practice your aim tracking, this game offer a really smooth tracking experience. Play Gunfire Reborn it is worth it ! aim training for furries :3
short_description: Gunfire Reborn is a level-based adventure game featuring FPS, Roguelite and RPG. Players can control heroes with various abilities to experience diverse Build gameplay, use various weapons to explore procedurally-generated levels. You can play the game alone, or join 4-player coop.

The art style, music, and voice acting â€”especially Logan Cunninghamâ€™s narrationâ€” are consistently engaging, and the charming world-building gradually pulls you in. After Hades, Iâ€™m really curious where Supergiant will go next. I finished this last January by the time of writing this review, I forgot to leave a positive review, but hey I did enjoy this game and it marked a starting point of me slowly tackling my backlog and finishing them. short_description: A free game in the truest sense of the word, TrackMania Nations Forever lets you drive at mind-blowing speeds on fun and spectacular tracks in solo and multiplayer modes.TrackMania Nations Forever offers a new "Forever" version of the Stadium environment, a solid solo mode and 65 brand new, progressively challenging tracks.

name: A Story About My Uncle
reviews:
Short and fast-paced, with every level getting harder and harder to smoothly glide through. The story bits and cutscenes slow it down a bit and give it some breathing room.
The gameplay is all about swinging, jumping, and rocketing yourself forward to reach different areas. Genuinely loving how gravity works in this game and the tools you obtain to go against it. This game can be challenging and I appreciate it for that!

The story is a cool concept that gets expanded upon nicely. The setup for more is right there, though the game ends before we get to anything specific. I think itâ€™s nicely put together and [i]it makes sense[i], but I wish there was just a little bit more.

Enjoyed it for 2+ hours, will probably go back to try and get the achievements :]

[strike] this is a part of my personal challenge for myself; to write an honest review of every game that's been sitting in my library, unplayed or unfinished [strike] -EN-

A heartwarming short story and parkour game in the style of "Arthur and the Minimoys". We play the main character's childhood memories as he explains his longing and admiration for his uncle. As an uncle (a proud one), this concept satisfied me.

The game length is appropriate; it doesn't try to be more ambitious than it is, and you can walk away from its simple story with a smile.

Finally, I would like to add that the voice actors were even better than the game itself.



-TR-

The movement is a crucial part of the games core gameplay â€“ focusing on swinging through the world with a grappling hook that gives the player a wonderful sense of speed and...

name: Metro: Last Light Redux
reviews:
if you want survival horror stress then play this Yes play it if you like stalker Despite the superb environmental design, created based on real places in Russia (mainly the metro systems), I clearly remember the detail that won me over: An abandoned station, a perfect portrait of apocalyptic decay; vines growing through cracks in the cement, moss, small insects and strange animals, unique mutations from that narrative. I remember entering a small room with a collapsed roof, just casually exploring the ruins looking for air filters, and then, a random decomposing body on the floor greets me with flies landing on my mask. The sound, the care with the details for the faithful representation of the decay of death... I was so stunned I could almost smell it.

The game knows how to play with your paranoia, especially in open areas. The post-apocalyptic landscape is breathtaking. Monster sounds keep your weapon drawn at all times, flooded buildings bring an oppressive and claustrophobic feeling of discomfort and fear. And the swamps? Falling into any deep water is an absolute horror; it's a game that, despite being linear, shows you that world is alive independent of your presence. Erratic, wet, and decomposed terrain combined with pure darkness defines much of this incredible atmosphere. Combat is satisfying, stealth is rewarding, and going into action is phenomenal.

Running out of air due to a lack of filters can be annoying? Yes. But this element is part of the game's oppressive composition: Everything is made to destabilize you as a player, to make you desperate and anxious. Many times I found myself in agony, firing shotgun shells randomly at creatures while running, searching for any mercy from a corpse with any abandoned filter.

I have never before played a game that knows how to play with sensations and primal instincts as strongly as Metro 2033. As I write this, I have just bought the book that inspired the game. I will certainly play it again, and I will certainly visit the other titles. Unfortunately, I started with the second one, but I'm already solified with it.
short_description: It is the year 2034. Beneath the ruins of post-apocalyptic Moscow, in the tunnels of the Metro, the remnants of mankind are besieged by deadly threats from outside â€“ and within. Mutants stalk the catacombs beneath the desolate surface, and hunt amidst the poisoned skies above.

A good choice if you like story-driven NFS games and action-focused racing.

name: Last Epoch
reviews:
I liked it Been playing ARPGs since the first Diablo, and honestly, Last Epoch is the game that finally made me feel that same old spark again. Iâ€™ve poured thousands of hours into Diablo, PoE, and multiple other ARPGs â€” and out of all of them, Last Epoch strikes the best balance between depth, fun, and sanity.

Itâ€™s got the build variety of Path of Exile, but without needing a 40-tab spreadsheet or YouTube degree just to make a character that works. The skill trees are awesome â€” theyâ€™re deep, creative, and actually *change* how your abilities play. Plus, the crafting system is hands down the best in the genre: simple enough to use right away, deep enough to chase perfect gear later. 

And gameplay-wise? It just feels good. Combat is tight, hits are satisfying, and performance is way smoother than what weâ€™ve been getting from some *massive* studios lately. Itâ€™s also super refreshing that the devs clearly care more about the player experience than pushing FOMO events or â€œlive serviceâ€ nonsense.

About the recent review bombing â€” honestly, itâ€™s pretty unfair. Most of it comes from people upset about monetization changes. The actual game, the one you play day to day, hasnâ€™t changed. Itâ€™s still one of the most polished, replayable, and genuine ARPGs out there.

If you love theorycrafting, fast-paced combat, and a game that respects your time, Last Epoch is absolutely worth your attention. Donâ€™t let the noise fool you â€” this oneâ€™s a gem. Great game!!
short_description: Uncover the Past, Reforge the Future. Ascend into one of 15 mastery classes and explore dangerous dungeons, hunt epic loot, craft legendary weapons, and wield the power of over a hundred transformative skill trees. Last Epoch is being developed by a team of passionate Action RPG enthusiasts.

name: HELLDIVERSâ„¢ 2
reviews:
One of the great games MY LIFE FOR SUPER EARTH! Gonna give a relatively straight-forward review of the game :-

The Goods :-

- The gameplay loop is amazing, dropping down to kill bugs/robots/squids and do different objectives whilst also expecting the unexpected makes it fresh for gameplay

- The plethora of weapons/stratagems gives diverse gameplay without it feeling "meta" , although this does take some time to unlock them. 

- The movement in this game (despite some bugs and glitches here and there) feels solid, down to earth and grounded.

The Bads : - 

- The performance of this game is abysmal. My frames only average around 45FPS and dips to around 30FPS during combat. I've tried every fix I can find but to no avail, I'm running quite a good rig (RTX3060Ti/I5-12600/32GB RAM) so I'm not sure what the issue here is, so I'll wait for Arrowhead to do thier magic, if they do tend on doing anything about. 

Overall rating :- 7/10. Worth buying, but hoping they fix the performance issues.
short_description: The Galaxyâ€™s Last Line of Offence. Enlist in the Helldivers and join the fight for freedom across a hostile galaxy in a fast, frantic, and ferocious third-person shooter.

name: Quantum Break
reviews:
Such a gem!!!! Fantastic! Remedy does some of the best stories in video games. This time, a wild time travel adventure with fun time powers to boot. Even nine years later, this game looks fantastic. The TV aspect I could have done without, though Lance Reddick was a standout in that part of the game. Overall, if you liked Remedy's other games, you gotta check this one out. This is a great game!
Love the action, but the story is in that Remedy-verse. Sci-fi mystery with a focus on time travel this go round. The abilities are awesome, the area puzzles aren't too complex, but still fun to solve. I think you can see a lot of what Control and in some ways Alan Wake 2 evolved from right here.
I've seen some complaints about the Junction points, but I think a lot of people might like it. You essentially get a 20 minute episode of the game that changes depending on your choices. Some just want to play constantly and don't care much for the story, but if you do, this is worth your time.
My only caveat is that the port isn't the best, so wait for a sale. I thought my PC was a decade beyond the requirements so I'd be good, but there just aren't enough options in the video and audio to get this running just right. Personally, I could get the frames smooth enough, but then the audio never felt right. There are some random clips during cinematics. And the off screen narative that the two characters are discussing while you play can get really quiet.
Worth a playthrough though!
short_description: From Remedy Entertainment, the masters of cinematic action games, comes Quantum Break, a time-amplified suspenseful blockbuster. The Quantum Break experience is part game, part live action showâ€”where decisions in one dramatically affect the other.

short_description: After a tragic incident, brothers Sean and Daniel Diaz run away from home. Fearing the police, and dealing with Daniel's new telekinetic power, the boys head to Mexico. Each stop on their journey brings new friends and new challenges.

name: Beholder
reviews:
Beholder (2016) â€“ Big Brother, But Make It Stressful ðŸ‘€

If youâ€™ve ever wondered what it feels like to be both a landlord and the governmentâ€™s nosiest employee, Beholder is here to crush your soulâ€”in a very entertaining way.

You play as Carl Stein, a perfectly normal guy whose job description includes fixing leaks, spying on tenants, planting bugs, reporting suspicious behavior, and occasionally deciding who goes to prison (no pressure). The game politely asks you moral questions like:
ðŸ‘‰ Do you report the family for owning an apple?
ðŸ‘‰ Do you save your kidâ€¦ or pay the electricity bill?

Every decision feels important, stressful, and somehow wrong. You start the game thinking, â€œIâ€™ll play smart and stay neutral.â€ Two hours later, youâ€™re broke, your family hates you, and youâ€™re hiding contraband in the bathroom while the clock screams at you.

The art style is dark, minimal, and perfectly matches the atmosphereâ€”everyone looks tired, scared, or guiltyâ€¦ including you. The soundtrack quietly reminds you that freedom is optional and consequences are mandatory.                                                                  Beholder is not just a gameâ€”itâ€™s a moral stress test disguised as pixel art. If you enjoy dark stories, difficult choices, and questioning your own ethics at 2 AM, this game is absolutely worth it.

Rating: 9/10
Would spy on tenants again. ðŸ•µï¸â€â™‚ï¸ this game its really fun and engaging, the story its gripping, the quests are unique, definely a must try, either as a rebel,or as a dictator, or you know, Clara ending Goofy ahh goated propaganda game

name: BATTLETECH
reviews:
Plays like the board game. Great for those who like to use actual game mechanics and tactics 850 hours, 800 in BTAU. If you're a fan of Battletech or tactical turn-based games then this title is a must. I'd recommend either BTAU or Roguetech to make this one of the best tactical games ever made. Absolutely fun game if you enjoy building mercenary companies and conducting turn-based combat.  I really enjoy the Mechwarrior universe.  It is unfortunate that there won't be a sequel to this game as it is a very strong improvement on MechCommander Gold.

Campaign is great.  The stuff that happens after the campaign is a bit mediocre and repetitive.  But I'd recommend buying this game for the campaign alone.
short_description: Take command of your own mercenary outfit of 'Mechs and the MechWarriors that pilot them, struggling to stay afloat as you find yourself drawn into a brutal interstellar civil war.

short_description: Surgeon Simulator is an over-the-top operation sim, stitching together pitch-black humour with life-saving surgery. Become Dr. Burke, a would-be surgeon with a less than conventional toolkit, as he performs procedures on patients including the Heavy from TF2! ...is that a hammer?

genres: Action, Free To Play, Massively Multiplayer, RPG, Early Access
name: Survarium
reviews:
I love the game. Great addicting game with intense PVP and action! Friendly active admins & developers with quick support. Can't wait to see what happens in the future. 
Don't get why peoble are so mad, if they began to read the devblogs they would know pve and open world isn't forgot. But pvp and gameplay mechanÃ­cs, and off couse stress tested servers that can handle high populated traffic is the devs main prioty. "But it take ages! I want open world and PVE now!" Yeah i get that. But this game isnt made by a AAA+ studio. and the resources are limit, things like that dosen't help the situation either, and that's why the devs have to priotize what is most important. Keep the good work guys! Ignore the mad audience and finnish this hidden gem. 

Pros:
+Alot of replay value
+Intense PVP action
+Great maps
+Great sounds
+Great community

Cons:
-Bots needs some work. 
-Too few maps
-Hit reg seems abit off sometimes

Hyped for:
!Open World Survival - Maybe something like Miscreated or Escape from Tarkov style
!New maps
!Pve content
!New game modes
!Upcoming updates
 Just another crappy F2P shooter, but with a superficial resmblance to the S.T.A.L.K.E.R. franchise.  There is no free roam, no looting and no storyline.  I don't know what survarium means or why this is tagged as survival, it should be called "Team Deathmatch-arium"

The online queue is broke or bugged, after waiting a minute plus the game will "find a match" but it just stays on the home screen and beeps, the bot practice mode (the only PvE option) works but it has zero progression rewards so all I can do is play bots in my lousy starting gear for no gain, or queue, wait, relog and repeat.

The shop seems like your typical F2P whale hunt, a few dull items you can grind for (IDK how bad the grind is because of the afformentionded queue bug), and tons of shiny cash-only items the wallet warriors can get right now. Great Game! 

+Nice Setting, really like the Stalker-theme
+ not P2W (you can get everytrhing buy just playing the game, leveling up as a free user is fast)
+Good gunplay (weapons feel the right way)
+Good Support (answering within 24h, very polite)
+Reasonable price tags, no 200â‚¬ op weapons or anything

The only problem is the low playercount - you q for about 2-3min every time. Give this game a chance, it's great!

And to all the people complaining about hackers:
I did not encounter one. On the other hand, many people complained that I would hack. Not everybody that outskills you has to be a hacker, just try to improve.
short_description: Survarium is a post-apocalyptic online FPS game. If you are looking for a shooter where skills matter, look no further! The opposing players and deadly anomalies will never stop you on the way to victory, right? Then start playing now for free!

name: Divinity: Original Sin - Enhanced Edition
reviews: Amazing game worth anyones time :) dated graphics but good fun
short_description: Gather your party and get ready for the kick-ass new version of GameSpot's PC Game of the Year 2014. With hours of new content, new game modes, full voiceovers, split-screen multiplayer, and thousands of improvements, there's never been a better time to explore the epic world of Rivellon!

short_description: Fight Today's War: Elite Special Forces in a gritty combat campaign using the surgical tactics of Tier 1 Operators combined with the sledgehammer force of Army Rangers.

I 100% hollow knight on PS5 and am leaving this review to support team cherry, absolute masterpiece of the game, both hollow knight and silksong
 banger This shit sucks!!!

name: The Elder Scrolls III: MorrowindÂ® Game of the Year Edition
reviews:
this game is janky as hell but it fucking rocks. the mainline and guild quests are 10x better than anything in skyrim. story is brilliant. one of the best roleplaying games of all time.

massive recommendation that you play OpenMW (more stable remake of the engine to prevent crashing and allow bigger mods) with the I Heart Vanilla - Director's Cut modpack, which includes the best mod of all, Tamriel Rebuilt. it includes most of mainland morrowind, complete with side quests, guild quests, collectables, and a whole postgame quest line in Necrom, all with the same quality as the original game. it's an entire extra Morrowind in your Morrowind. Easy to mod while maintaining the spirit of vanilla Morrowind. With OpenMW, it's (maybe) the most stable Bethesda game.

It's aged well; worth replaying. Phenomanal
short_description: The Elder Scrolls III: MorrowindÂ® Game of the Year Edition includes Morrowind plus all of the content from the Bloodmoon and Tribunal expansions. The original Mod Construction Set is not included in this package. An epic, open-ended single-player RPG, Morrowind allows you to create and play any kind of character imaginable.

name: Nioh: Complete Edition
reviews: yes Dudes and dudets this is pure fun,  don't be in a rush to kill all the bosses but take it in  each encounter is strategic, chaos, and pure fun. Find u , ur on playstyle(stance), ur own fav weapon and ur own  drip in short am in love and i think u will too good for your bones
short_description: Ready to die? Experience the newest brutal action game from Team NINJA and Koei Tecmo Games. In the age of samurai, a lone traveler lands on the shores of Japan. He must fight his way through the vicious warriors and supernatural Yokai that infest the land in order to find that which he seeks.

reviews: woooloooolloo Great remaster of an amazing older PC game. Always been one of my favorites. It's very good! Get the newer Definitive edition now.

reviews: I got addicted to this game, suffering withdrawls now that I finished it... australia made this so its good Lamb is God
short_description: Start your own cult in a land of false prophets, venturing out into diverse and mysterious regions to build a loyal community of woodland Followers and spread your Word to become the one true cult.

name: The Evil Within
reviews:
The game feels very tryhard in its overall presentation, very bloody very hardcore very PsYcHoLiGiCaL but it's just loud gore thrown in my face. It's more recycling popular games and every mechanics from games released at the time rather than being its own thing. Instead of getting a good vibe from the video games that inspired it, it just serves me as a reminder that I should be playing those games instead.

As I was straight up not enjoying myself, I died and I don't mind except it took me back 15 minutes behind. I know older games like the PS1 resident evils would do that, but those are games you have control over when you save the game. Evil Within mixes manual saves, in-between chapter saves and automatic checkpoints in a weird way I have little control over. I routed and looted an entire area and then died to the boss, now the whole area respawned. 5.5/10. nice game
short_description: Developed by Shinji Mikami -- creator of the seminal Resident Evil series -- and the talented team at Tango Gameworks, The Evil Within embodies the meaning of pure survival horror. Highly-crafted environments, horrifying anxiety, and an intricate story are combined to create an immersive world that will bring you to the height of tension.

name: LEGOÂ® Star Warsâ„¢: The Skywalker Saga
reviews:
This game does not have the same charm as all other Lego games, they really switched the style/mechanics of the whole thing. Also every level follows the same exact format which made me want to stop playing after episode 3. The fights are all also exactly the same, and unexciting every time. I understand the game is primarily for kids but not having anything change in terms of puzzles, fights, or formula each level cant be fun for them either. 

The worlds and minifigs are beautiful though. Complete saga still on top very fun lot of a grind 
 The best lego star wars game yet!
short_description: Play through all nine Skywalker saga films in a game unlike any other. With over 300 playable characters, over 100 vehicles, and 23 planets to explore, a galaxy far, far away has never been more fun! *Includes classic Obi-Wan Kenobi playable character

name: TEKKEN 7
reviews: GOOD FIGHTING GAME My favorite quote from Takken 7 is "I don't know who you are. I don't know what you want. If you are looking for ransom, I can tell you I don't have money. But what I do have are a very particular set of skills, skills I have acquired over a very long career. Skills that make me a nightmare for people like you. If you let my daughter go now, that'll be the end of it. I will not look for you, I will not pursue you. But if you don't, I will look for you, I will find you, and I will kill you." good
short_description: Discover the epic conclusion of the long-time clan warfare between members of the Mishima family. Powered by Unreal Engine 4, the legendary fighting game franchise fights back with stunning story-driven cinematic battles and intense duels that can be enjoyed with friends and rivals.

genres: Action, Casual, Indie, Massively Multiplayer, Sports
name: Fall Guys
reviews: Completely janky and unplayable. Locks up and only gives me 6 frames every 4 seconds. I even tried running it via epic games launcher and same deal. And it's not my computer, it runs everything else just fine. one of the wrost game i played in a while Fun game but fuck epic for buying it and getting rid of all the free cosmetics and making it all micro transactions
short_description: Fall Guys is a free, cross-platform massively multiplayer party royale game. Clumsily compete in absurd obstacle courses with friends or build your very own chaotic course to share with the community.

name: Resident Evil Village
reviews: An EXCELLENT addition to the franchise! This is certainly more action than 7, but the environment, enemies, story and gameplay are all top notch. Plus, there are a lot of good things to keep you around after the main story. The DLC is good. Mercenaries is VERY good and there are many fun challenges and unlocks in new game plus. 9/10 One of the best resident evil games ever great quality great optimization and great story in the same time a bit hard on hard difficulty but over all an amazing game worth it's price it good
short_description: Experience survival horror like never before in the 8th major installment in the Resident Evil franchise - Resident Evil Village. With detailed graphics, intense first-person action and masterful storytelling, the terror has never felt more realistic.

name: Phasmophobia
reviews:
got rate Shit's hella cold, can hear static, and can see footprints, have double checked 2-3x, have looked at guides online -- guess Jinn.

Nope, it's a Yokai and you and your friends suck at being ghost hunters because you're using Dollar General introductory equipment that doesn't do anything.

But if you want to get the "professional" equipment to detect the right ghosts, you need to level up....

... detecting the right ghosts.

Great game on the surface, love the potential depth, but needs some "free-for-all" modes that make the experience with friends on a random Friday night much more palatable. Peak
short_description: Phasmophobia is a 4 player online co-op psychological horror. Paranormal activity is on the rise and itâ€™s up to you and your team to use all the ghost-hunting equipment at your disposal in order to gather as much evidence as you can.

name: Destiny 2
reviews:
I played this game since its launch, back when it was on battle.net and everything, last I remember online tools clocked my account at around 4,000 hours played in total. I was there in year one when there was basically nothing to do. I watched it turn into one of my favorite games of all time, and then watched it slowly rot until I had to quit. Did basically everything available, all the raids, pinnacle gear, etc. I had a lot of fucking investment i this game, which made it all that much harder to pull away. I can't say I haven't looked back, the guns are some of my favorites, ever, but its not fucking worth it. Don't let it fool you. Shortsighted shitheaded decision after decision, continuous deliberate kneecapping of fun in the name of further grind, of more monetization, of extracting more and more and more money in return for less and less. Destruction of content bought and paid for because of bad management decisions prioritizing new content over maintaing the game. Destruction of player investment for the same reasons. Festivals get more monetized, the grind gets worse, and youre asked to spend more money for less content thats worse. I've spent a year now on and off trying to figure out how to write this review and there really just is not a way to properly express my feelings. Do not play this fucking game. If you are playing this game, do not spend another cent on it. not worth, free to play more like free to pay 
its calm back in the day 8/10, now 4/10 so overall 6/10 L game tbh
short_description: Destiny 2 is an action MMO with a single evolving world that you and your friends can join anytime, anywhere, absolutely free.

name: Cyberpunk 2077
reviews:
Absolutely masterful.  Whatever issues may have plagued this game on launch - as of 2025 (going into 2026) - software here is spotless.  The story and [i]game[/i] underneath shine as brightly as I imagine was intended from the get-go.

I didn't rightly [i]know[/i] what I was getting into here.  I have no prior experience with CDPR games, so the writing took me by surprise.  If I had to expect anything, it would have been another Skyrim - a long list of checkboxes to tick and a rote, tired gameplay loop that gets boring as quickly as you reach the end of it, padded out by bullet sponge enemies or simply making you [i]walk farther.[/i]  A bunch of faceless, soulless PG-13 robots that exist to push you along to the next theme park ride.  But that's not at all what we've got here, not by a long shot.

I look at this, look at the hours I've put in here, in what feels like such a small amount of time, and I do not consider one minute of that time wasted.  Of course, there were issues, but they were so infrequent that experiencing the issues themselves stood out to me.  The fact that any occurred at all made me realize how seldom they happened.  There is no 'filler' here.  Everything that exists does so for a purpose, and of the time spent just going from A to B, there was always something fun to do in between, whether that was some kind of side-thing, or just the movement itself.  Everything was done fantastically.  Of the issues I had throughout my time with this game, all of them were either forgotten or resolved themselves before the end.

Truly the only issue that hasn't been fixed is that there isn't [i]more[/i] to some of the narratives, but nothing feels like it got the MGSV treatment.  Nothing here is half-finished or cut short, the game's lore doesn't just exist stuffed away in audio or text logs - though there are plenty of the latter if you like reading.  Some things just end on a cliffhanger.  Things you're never meant to know, maybe.

This game isn't the kind you can make a sequel to, I don't think.  At least not for another decade or so, give or take some kind of narrative epiphany.

The story was written by people who understand how people speak, and did not pull punches for the sake of pleasing either the player themselves or the PC in-universe.  There [i]are[/i] cases where you have to make decisions and you cannot do everything you can possibly want in one playthrough.  There are decisions with consequences that will affect how you play, and more importantly, how you [i]feel[/i].  You can savescum of course, but the only one you're cheating is yourself.  Robbing yourself of the experience you've just invested hours into seeing through.  This is not a game for the guy who wants to save everyone.  There's no all-seeing god looking over you to lower your score at the end for killing people instead of knocking them out.  There's just you, the world, and your conscience.

The topics covered in this game's story, among other things it holds, have always been extremely interesting to me in particular.  There are so many parallels here to things I've personally dealt with in my life, things I've already had to consider, problems I've solved or thought I had solved, now staring me right back in the face, in a way that seems as real as any sort of digital "reality C" can possibly ever be.  It may as well be real, with how it f-cks with my head.  I guess that's just art, isn't it?

This game made me change as a person, for the better.  Sounds dramatic, but that's the truth.  Through all the sci-fi bullsh-t, I see bits of myself in this thing.  I have walked away with new, perception-altering experiences tucked away somewhere in my brain, to inform my behavior down the line, am I to ever find my way into these situations again.

Maybe now I'll put together what being alive means.  I've got the pieces right in front of me - Disco, NITW, and the rest from my time in meatspace.  Maybe this was the last one. very pretty and cool and boobs or whatever Play it
short_description: Cyberpunk 2077 is an open-world, action-adventure RPG set in the dark future of Night City â€” a dangerous megalopolis obsessed with power, glamor, and ceaseless body modification.

Game is good, but it's entirely full of pointless minigames and all parts feel added on with no consistancy.

Game is litterly about a white man who moves in randomly and start taking all of the resources. There's like a "bad guy" corporation and that's cool or whatever, but there's so much tacked ontop of so much else it's hard to enjoy or get to any of it. 

No depth in any mechanics, this doesn't lead to a casual feel, this is just doing chore like minigames over and over to progress this story that's about... unlocking more minigames. Honestly excellent. er
short_description: DAVE THE DIVER is a casual, singleplayer adventure RPG featuring deep-sea exploration and fishing during the day and sushi restaurant management at night. Join Dave and his quirky friends as they seek to uncover the secrets of the mysterious Blue Hole.

name: Outer Wilds
reviews:
I've tried beating this game three times and failed each time. I just can't do it. Impatient, stupid, difficulty with recognizing patterns, I'm not sure. And although I made it further each attempt, I'm not going to waste my time any further.

The game unfolds progressively and isn't overtly challenging, but the "connecting bits" of certain tools, concepts, and ideas seem to unfold well over the course of the story, but the controls of the jetpack are often frustrating, the platforming is often obnoxious, and the timed puzzle experience (having to get into a specific small-ass room within one minute of Groundhog Day-ing) were all extremely annoying gameplay loops that I didn't find enjoyable.

So why am I not giving this game a bad review?

Because even if I'm not personally the intended target, I recognize that this game is absolutely brilliant and should be picked up by everyone and tried at least once. It's gorgeous, it's bold, and based on what I played it's brilliantly executed and designed. 

Not my cuppa tea, but I gotta respect the game. It's a crazily well built game. This game is not for everyone, but it is a masterpiece if you have any interest in the game at all. If you like all of the following points, I highly recommend getting the game:
- Space/Gravity Physics
- Exploration
- Solo Adventure
- Mystery/Puzzles
- Challenging castaways.
short_description: Named Game of the Year 2019 by Giant Bomb, Polygon, Eurogamer, and The Guardian, Outer Wilds is a critically-acclaimed and award-winning open world mystery about a solar system trapped in an endless time loop.

name: Lobotomy Corporation | Monster Management Simulation
reviews: This is a fun little Hell- I mean management sim where you can send wholesome little guys to their de- erm actually I meant to work on some really cute dogs! Like Nothing There! And then there's also.. Gebura.. erm.. I like her suit, anyway, 10/10 would recommend to any masochist. my corporation was Lobotomized 10/10 game If you're a masochistic freak, you'll love this game. It will also consume your life. Play at your own risk
short_description: A roguelite monster-management simulation inspired by the likes of the SCP Foundation, Cabin in the Woods, and Warehouse 13. Order your employees to perform work with the creatures and watch as it unfolds; harness greater energy, and expand the facility

name: Fallout: New Vegas
reviews:
I admit that this game is not for everyone, but if you can forgive it's dated graphics and frequent bugs, you will find one of the best stories to ever be told in a role playing video game format. That's not to say there isn't silly moments, exploration, and ultraviolent fun to be had, there is PLENTY of that as well, but it is always kept in balance with a solid plot that isn't afraid to have serious moments.

New Vegas drops you in a civil war between the New California Republic, a wealthy but struggling democracy attempting to bring peace and emulate the culture and values of the pre-war United States, Ceasar's Legion, a group of glorified raiders adopting Imperial Rome-era aesthetics and beliefs on a mission to pillage and enslave the population of Vegas, and Mr. House, the mysterious leader of New Vegas who oversees it's casinos away from public eye. You are a courier hired to deliver a package to Vegas, but are robbed and nearly killed by a group of mercenaries, predicting your arrival.

Right off the bat you are given a seemingly vague starting objective and free choice to dash through the main story or to go on misadventures on your own accord. As you progress further on, tensions rise and you will be made to choose which faction you believe in most, or allow all sides to crumble and shoot for independence of Vegas, with it's pros and cons.

Its hard to overstate the endless customization and replayability offered by the character builds and actions you're allowed in both side quests and the main story. When so many RPGs attempt to force you into a specific playstyle or path taken, this game is a wonderful change of pace. Still one of the all-time greatest video games. One of those rare Bethesda-style games from that publisher that also stands well on its own without mods, which is a feat that's only been replicated by Oblivion and Morrowind before it and nothing since. If you're so inclined, though, mods from nexus are a must-have for this game, even just to add quality of life improvements such as sprinting. The game really does show it's age, even now, but the dialogue, writing, story, and decisions are top-notch. 

The best DLC is Dead Money -- but some people found it frustrating. It was fair and rewarding with a realistic-damage mod, so while I was one-hit, I could also fight back sometimes.

Anyway, this is a game that continues to hold up to this day, and one of my all-time favorite playthroughs of any game ever was recently in NV. it bad
short_description: Welcome to Vegas. New Vegas. Enjoy your stay!

reviews: game is a masterpiece The overall storyline is interesting and the game play was fun and challenging at multiple points. Where I have an issue with it is that to get the real ending takes a few replays of very similar content that gets repetitive. On top of that if you want to finish it in the spirit of the game at the very end everything you work for is deleted. I don't know about others, but I don't have infinite time to replay a game just to unlock other things I missed. I could have saved myself 40+ hours and just watched someone's video covering the story points. An absolute masterpiece about the meaning of life and the struggle of humanism. It will have you weep for the suffering of machines while you question your own existence. Wrapped in a beautiful world full of amazing characters, each looking for their own answers. The music will give you goosebumps over and over again. The greatest video game of all time, there I said it.

name: Monster Hunter Wilds
reviews:
I love the series anyone saying its just a cash grab are kinda dumb of course we are gonna get vanity goodies on steam, and no one is forcing you to buy anything and you get literally 0 advantages from those items so if you are complaining about that im sorry but you're dumb LOL

Also with optimization, are your drivers and such all updated, maybe your pc isnt as great as it was 5 years ago :) been playing on a latptop since release and never once had any issues running on Max settings lol 

as a long time hunter i gotta say i love the game but the lack of basic hunter etiquette is astonding. If you dont start the quest you dont get to decide if its a capture or slay its not all about speed you new hunter nubs lol stop speedrunning and capturing everything ffs and dont comment on someone elses armor build "meta" doesnt exist you hunt how you want to hunt. This game has hit a new low.  MH has always dragged you through nonsense boring story to get the real main loop, farming creatures to get the materials to make the gear to take on bigger monsters. That really is the appeal of the game. But, 20 hours in and I'm still locked behind story walls unable to do proper crafting or gear planning. Still slogging through this stupid on-rails nonsense and that includes skipping all the cut scenes and dialog I can. I really don't know wtf Capcom were thinking. Taking the most enjoyable parts out and leaving the garbage nobody likes. And I had to turn off controller vibration because never ending vibration when certain monsters are around doesn't add atmosphere it's just annoying and probably brings an early onset of arthritis. I had a great time with this game up until they added Omega Planetes. I have fought that single monster with my team, with other hunters, and with the computer hunters. I have transcended armor, looked up builds, tried different weapons and no matter what I do I get wrecked every single time. There is hard and then there is ridiculous and that has effectively ruined this game for me until they release better gear or something to make that fight even remotely enjoyable.

name: Stellaris
reviews:
This is a bit preemptive I know but with regards to to proposed changes the devs are testing in the current 4.3 beta, I can not recommend this game to others.

It feels that the devs are reacting to the competitive youtube community by reducing how well their specifically tailored empires snowball without looking at the wider community as a whole.  The changes aslo remove the feel of managing a large, galaxy spanning empire.

For example, an anchorage will currently supply 4 naval capacity which would support 4 corvettes.  With their proposed changes, anchorages would supply 5 naval capacity but that would only support 1 corvette, since their required supply would go from 1 to 5. It's a sad day, I went back to Stellaris after so long, because updates ruined mods. When I entered the game, I found a mess, it was impossible to govern my Empire. transferring pops, intuitive things, all of them impossible to handle. The game was amazing like two years before, and now, it's frankly it's a unmanagable garbage dump now. I never thought I would thumbs down Stellaris, but until some things are reversed, I'm hiding it from my library. It's really fun once you figure out what each button does (as with most paradox games)
short_description: Explore a galaxy full of wonders in this sci-fi grand strategy game from Paradox Development Studios. Interact with diverse alien races, discover strange new worlds with unexpected events and expand the reach of your empire. Each new adventure holds almost limitless possibilities.

name: Warhammer 40,000: Inquisitor - Martyr
reviews:
Simple fun in the usual setting. It is on the easy side of these type of games, but it offers a very good variety. Campaign is ok. The scenario get repetitive after a bit. It is a good action RPG and a great Warhammer game. The skills and characters are solid, with some better than others. However, the skills and some of the game mechanics could have been explained better.
A lot of what makes the game cool is hidden unless you really dig into it and experiment on your own. If you like ARPGs and addictive gameplay, this game is for you. On a discount, it is a must-buy. Keep in mind that the main quest ends on a cliffhanger clearly meant to encourage you to spend money on the DLCâ€”thereâ€™s a lot of that here. Mission-based aRPG fun that feels less grindy than most aRPGs these days. I rolled credits on the main campaign after about 25 hours and that was including some of the DLC content in my run. I can see running my toon up to max level just for fun.
short_description: Enter the Chaos-infested Caligari Sector and purge the unclean with the most powerful agents of the Imperium of Man! W40k: Inquisitor â€“ Martyr is a grim Action-RPG featuring multiple classes of the Inquisition who will carry out the Emperorâ€™s will.

chill game

name: Battlefield 3â„¢
reviews:
BF3 was my first Battlefield game, it introduced me the franchise, and to this day it's still my all time FPS game. Good to see it's still active and playable today. My only issue I have so far is the constant EA App (Formally known as Origin) errors, as for the game itself it's an amazing game that still holds up quite well today. Hope some of its maps return in BF6 one day. I played it originally on my Playstation 3 when I was growing up. As of me writing this review, I still think this is the best Battlefield game. 4 always gets the spotlight, but I always felt like it was "too much of a good thing" & hella unbalanced because of it. If anything, Battlefield 1 (Specifically the World War 1 one) was incredible & got close to dethroning this one. 

Maybe it's just nostalgia, but i'll always have a special place in my heart for this game Taking notice of the year this game was published, the games graphics are ahead of its time and consists of modern warfare based on current army equipment. The storyline isn't too long, nor too short, whilst keeping the story actually interesting. There aren't too many cutscenes in the campaign, but the ones in the game are filled with action and fascinating lore, keeping you engaged. The campaign is perfect for someone who might not have a lot of time on their hands and is looking for something to play in the evenings. Although the story might be great, I haven't, however tried the multiplayer out yet, and doubt I will do so, taking into consideration this games age, there really aren't many people playing the multiplayer modes, and I suggest buying this game only for the campaign.
short_description: Enjoy total freedom to fight the way you want. Explore 29 massive multiplayer maps and use loads of vehicles, weapons, and gadgets to help you turn up the heat. Every second of battle gets you closer to unlocking tons of extras and moving up in the Ranks. So get in the action.

short_description: Return to an apocalyptic Earth in Darksiders III, a hack-n-slash Action Adventure where players assume the role of FURY in her quest to hunt down and dispose of the Seven Deadly Sins. The most enigmatic of the Four Horsemen, FURY must bring balance to the forces that now ravage Earth.

name: Call of DutyÂ®: Infinite Warfare
reviews:
its so good
 THE GAME DOES NOT LAUNCH DO NOT BUY THIS GAME. Arguably the best and most soulful zombies experience you can get in any COD. It is on par with the previous entries in terms of quality, content, and gameplay. You are absolutely in the right for buying a whole game for 1/3 of its content if that is all that interests you; there is still at least 150 hours of content in just the zombies mode. Yes, there are good fate and fortune cards (this game's gobble gums) only acquired in loot boxes, but... there are always ways to get a ton of them. 

After 9 years, I still haven't played the campaign, but a lot of people praise it, from what I've read, so that's a great plus to hear. 

Multiplayer has been a mixed bag for a long time. To start off, you are probably never going to find a good MP match on PC unless you join the discord and get a genuine group of non-cheaters. I have only played MP on PC once and it started off pretty fun, then a cheater joined after 10 or so matches. Also, you will never find anyone on beyond the weekend evening times. I'm not going to complain about meta weapons since that issue exists in pretty much every shooter game ever made. The only other gripe is the loot box system as it is one of the most wallet draining MTX practices ever created. However, the MP has so many awesome game modes that you don't see anymore, and it is a shame to see them all never be played again. Only the console versions have a small but active population, and it sucks being in my shoes (lol) because I have given up on playing Xbox MP due to the fact I am so bad at using a controller in a game like this where you have to jump up high and run along walls to stay alive.

This game has a lot of soul though, not just in zombies. From the sound effects, to all the little love notes to previous MW entries, I still enjoy playing it and it hurts my heart even more that this game will probably never see any resurgence of any kind. It already had its one and only chance with its mini resurgence with youtubers playing the zombies and recommending it in the recent years, so my hopes are very low. It doesn't help that this was the one game where the entirety of the world decided, "nah this game shouldn't do well, we want more grounded CODs from now on"; also that the PC version had very low sales for a good while. 

I will defend this game to my last breath. Absolutely buy it on sale as it's a great price compared to what Activision sells the older COD packages for.
short_description: Infinite Warfare delivers three unique game modes: Campaign, Multiplayer, and Zombies.

name: Brothers - A Tale of Two Sons
reviews:
sick game with twisted ending
 Touching game but pretty sad and forgettable. Lacks that it is solo, could have been perfect for coop An amazing game and a highly recommend to anyone. The story is simple, with no dialogue so it is accessible for anyone to play. The mechanic to control both brothers in single player really hits home and is one of the best uses of game mechanics for its time. I still need to make time to play the remake as well.

name: Overcooked! 2

name: The Elder ScrollsÂ® Online
reviews:
nice Love this. If you enjoyed Skyrim then this will be enjoyable too. A simplified combat system with some nice perks. Graphics are smooth and so far no lag anywhere. At the time of this review I had only the base game.

Pros: lots of missions, lots of activities, lots of players, mounts are really good, combat system simplified with nice perks, large maps.

Cons: character creator is good but the characters you can make look like Skyrim style (not very detailed), a lot of people running around with unrealistic mounts and pets - very Final Fantasy like skins, there is only one swimming speed - I think it is just to save you from drowning if you mess up.

9/10. Would play again!

It perfectly captures that white knuckle feeling of racing on the edge as you hurtle along dangerous roads, knowing that one crash could irreparably harm your stage time.

name: DEATH STRANDING DIRECTOR'S CUT
reviews:
Absolute Cinema! I was a little late to the death stranding hype train. I had initially tried out the game on my PS5 but only got about 3 hours in before I dumped the game, but in retrospect this game needs to be approached from a different mindset than one of most games. 

The real heart of this game is, as the game puts it, making strands with those around you, and I am talking about the connections you make even outside of the story.  The genius of kojima was making players want to contribute to shared goals, be it a bridge to cross a deep river on a main road or making some zip lines to traverse the mountains better for some remote npcs or even just leaving a bike out for your fellow porters. The amount of time I personally went out of my way to get resources to help rebuild others structures or help finish up some necessary roads took a large chuck of my time in this games America. Knowing that the structures I helped build would be beneficial to my fellow porters gave me a sense of accomplishment as they would be appreciated by players. 

I cannot wait for the sequel to finally land on pcs here in the near future to continue Samâ€™s story and helping out my fellow porters. Keep On Keeping On. I got this on sale at 15.99 during 2025 Winter Sale.

Let me just say the first couple hours is pretty slow due to setting up the story and what not which can through people off. 

The game is a lot more than just "being a delivery man". It also has the stealthiness you come to expect from a Kojima game and yes you do get weapons in the game, the first 2-3 hours can make you think you'll never get one but trust me you finally get one in time, once the game picks up in just went into a ruins  that had a quite a bit of enemies  inside while doing a Main Mission. 

Setting up little spots where you can charge your gear, build bridges, use ladders scale mountains, having your own Motorcycle so you can carry all your loot you found with relative ease. 

I'm still playing but so far it's worth every penny, heck it's worth the 40 they would charge if not for the sale. That's just my opinion.
short_description: From legendary game creator Hideo Kojima comes a genre-defying experience, now expanded in this definitive DIRECTORâ€™S CUT. As Sam Bridges, your mission is to deliver hope to humanity by connecting the last survivors of a decimated America. Can you reunite the shattered world, one step at a time?

name: Dragon Age: Origins - Ultimate Edition
reviews:
I have been a Dragon Age fan since 2009, I have put thousands of hours into the series and I can say with confidence Dragon Age Origins is one of the greatest RPG games ever made. I cannot put into words how incredible this game is, the story, the characters, the world building and lore are so in depth and come together to create an unforgettable game with so much replay value. The ONLY downside is it is quite old and outdated and this is obvious - but that is not reason enough to skip this game. If you play this game you will fall in love with your companions, build a character from scratch, picking a unique origin and building the world around you based on your decisions and game style. with well over 50 hours worth of content, not including the DLC which help expand the already vast storyline of Dragon Age Origins. A must play if you love Baldurs Gate 3 or Skyrim, or even another amazing game made by Bioware - the Mass Effect triology! :) nice This game holds up surprisingly well considering the time it was made. Like all games in the series, it can benefit from some mod installation, mostly run speed and the fact that it crashes without a RAM patch (? weird considering the GOG version fixes this?)

Here are some aspects that stood out to me :
- Worldbuilding : Ferelden feels like a real place and every NPC and enemies are put careful through the world so that the assets put build a story in itself
- Character development : I can say that this is one of the few games where I felt like my active character choices had an impact on the actual game. You mean to say that I picked a dwarf and 50 hours in I still get interactions due to it? Cool as hell!
- Story : Gets a bit weird near the end but overall is solid. The best way i can compare it to is BG3, where act 1 and 2 are masterpieces and you kinda get burnt near the end so it feels a bit tedious. They also throw you in an almost unbeatable fight, which felt weird to me at least because I felt like a kill all machine on normal difficulty.
- Gameplay : Took a while but it clicked like magic to a point where i was missing it in the other entries. Micromanagement seems to be my type of game and making tactics was so damn fun. In my playthrough Morrigan was a glass canon support mage and while she died a lot it was still fun building her.
- Content : This game is huge and doesn't lack in side quests at all. I played like 50h and I still didn't do anything
- Voice acting : I mean its been said a lot need I go into it like others. It feels like actual interactions and I love how characters will pop in to say their thoughts and they don't necessarily allign with me

Overall a classic and I'm glad I ended up playing it. Ending might be a bit dissapointing but it doesn't mean it's bad by any means. Some of the DLC is useless but I recommend following Morrigan's story.
short_description: Explore a stunning world, make complex moral choices, and engage in bone-crushing combat against massive and terrifying creatures. The Ultimate Edition includes Dragon Age: Origins, Dragon Age: Origins - Awakening and all nine content packs.

name: Magic Duels
reviews:
It helped me to learn Magic when I was just getting started.
Now it's just a fun time waster!
And the "story" mode ain't half bad! 
Can't really hate on the things I don't really like because it was free!
Free is good.
 For a long time it was a fun game with a lot of little flaws; great for scratching that itch to play MtG when I hadn't for about 10 years. The one thing that finally made me quit was the introduction of daily quests with very specific requirements that only work in PvP.  Even with a daily quest refresh, this often ends up requiring you to use decks in PvP that are substandard either because they don't fit the meta or you don't have enough cards unlocked to build them.

So, in short, the best way to unlock cards now often depends on already having cards unlocked. In PvP.

I understand this was probably an effort to get people to buy boosters. The game does need to make money or it gets shut down, of course. And while there are things I would pay for, boosters are not one of them. I started playing Duels [i]specifically to get away from having to pay for boosters[/i]. If Stainless wanted to get money from me there are some things they could charge for:
[list][*]Access to older blocks (i.e. ~$5-10 for a block that comes with a few boosters, then you have to unlock the rest with earned or purchased coins)
[*]Access to alternate game modes like Sealed (where you don't keep the cards), Vanguard, Commander, etc. [/list]

At any rate, it's still a better game than Hearthstone. Match making doesn't distinguish based on your card availability. So if you start new, you can be matched against people who have put down money to get extra cards.  This obviously puts you at a severe handicap unless you are willing to spend money. 
It is not really free-to-play unless you like playing against easy to beat bots.
short_description: MORE CARDS. MORE STRATEGY. BIGGER STORY. Collect 1,300+ earnable cards, battle in 60+ single-player campaign missions, and emerge victorious in epic online duels.

name: Katana ZERO
reviews: wonderful game. all 3 hours of this were amazing. i loved the story i was shocked and YES you should get this game. this might be one of the best indie games i've played EVER. 10/10 Absolute Masterpiece A masterpiece of a short game. The story is interesting enough to captivate and it develops very well, constantly adding layer upon layer, just like the gameplay, which starts easy and becomes challenging quickly. Its forte, aside from the beautiful pixel art, is the way dying and continuing are marvellously well linked to the main plot, with some jaw-dropping moments and very trippy, sometimes frantic and psychotic, moments. I wish it would be more of an RPG and not so much a shooting/slashing gallery, and that it could maybe last a bit longer. It feels like an interactive movie, at points, but the quality makes it very enjoyable. I couldn't stop playing, did the whole thing on one go. 10/10.
short_description: Katana ZERO is a stylish neo-noir, action-platformer featuring breakneck action and instant-death combat. Slash, dash, and manipulate time to unravel your past in a beautifully brutal acrobatic display.

reviews: Doesn't function well as either a mystery or puzzle game, and much of the writing ends up feeling weaker in hindsight. I loved the simplicity and the point-and-click playstyle. It may have been a little too easy but it had what I look for in casual gaming. The puzzles are able to be figured out and I'm not stuck looking for guides on how to do everything. I did beat this game in about 4.5 hours but it only cost .99c so I really can't complain! I really liked this and the 2nd, I hope there will be more Kathy Rain! .
