name: Fortified
reviews:
I know that we don't know each other, but, don't. Just don't. Game crashes, no fix available If you like tower defense games with a FPS element you will like this game, If you played and finished the Orcs Must Die series this will give you that little itch for maybe 10ish hours. I love playing games like this so I enjoyed my time playing this game. However I'm not sure its worth 15$. The Campaign is 12 missions (I think) which are pretty good imo. I played with my gf who isn't very good at games and I thought the game was the right amount of stressful. There is an endless mode so if you're into that you can also play a few maps like that. The game has decent customization between classes, I felt as if all of them are viable with a lot of structures overlapping between classes which is nice. Same with weapons. 

Cons: It is fairly short. I think even if they added a map editor for people to make their own maps and publish for people to download and play it would really make the price worth it. 

Final: If you like games like OMD, Bish Bash robots, Toy soldiers; you will like this game, Put it on your wishlist and when it goes on sale pick it up!
short_description: Fortified is an explosive strategy shooter where players will defend the Earth against a menacing Martian invasion in the 1950s. Play as one-of-four pulp inspired heroes as they fight swarms of terrifying robots with an arsenal of Cold War era weapons and experimental technology.

name: Heaven Forest NIGHTS
reviews:
[h1]
Journey to cr4p and beyond.
[/h1] [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/43362349/]Walking SIM curator review: 2/10[/url] A mediocre Walking Sim + Collectathon that has aged poorly since its 2017 release. Even by the standards of that era I think that it is a fairly weak effort especially when it comes to the gameplay. The physics is very bad, jumping feels like floating and also you can air jump infinitely, turning it into a bad flying sim. Quite a lot of the scenery has no collider so you can just walk through trees and even sometimes buildings. As far as I can tell thereâ€™s zero repercussions to whether or not you collect or miss the fairly arbitrarily strewn about collectibles. Indeed, I donâ€™t think the game has an end. Unless you happen to tap the escape key, at which point you will be dropped back to Steam instantly with no prompt to confirm.

If we continue to judge the game by the standards of 2017 the graphics and level design are fine. Indeed one might even praise its single level, as it is fairly generously large, and clearly wasnâ€™t set out by random chance but was partitioned into fairly distinct areas with different styles and some nice vistas to peer out over.  However, unless you have been playing on a potato, you will be accustomed to *far* better rendering than this game offers. And even if you donâ€™t mind low resolution imagery, the game is beset by quite a lot of pop in. Reasonable for 2017, not so much for 2025.

In conclusion: I can overlook a lot but when the gameplay isnâ€™t good, and the graphics offer no distraction from mediocre gameplay, why am I still here? Well, it does have Steam Cards. Probably thatâ€™s why people buy and play it still, especially given that it can be purchased on sale for half a dollar. At that cost it doesnâ€™t really seem worth refunding, though on principle I remain tempted. [h2]Heaven Forest NIGHTS[/h2]

Has a total of [b]10[/b] trading cards.
short_description: The sequel to the Heaven Forest series. While the first game was about the meaning of life, this new one is about its opposite: what is the meaning of death? Since we are sentient beings who know that sooner or later we will die, do our efforts in the everyday life have a meaning at all?

name: Guacamelee! Super Turbo Championship Edition
reviews:
pretty slow at first but the combat starts to really shine and feel more fun as you unlock more abilities, and the side content is cool too Another day, another looking at games I played the last decade before a long hiatus.

Maybe not a memory as amazing as the first Ori game but I had a great time with Guacamelee, so great I in fact ended up playing this Super Turbo edition later, too. It even acknowledges being a later update ironically, as at the end of an important early cutscene, the additional boss pops up asking "missed something?"

The graphics are so stylized, colorful, and lively, and like any good metroidvania, every new ability opens up a lot of new areas and possibilities. I love how the uppercut attack works as a double jump before you find a true double jump (and for quite a while I thought there wouldn't be one).

I'm still not a big fan of the "arenas" where from time to time you are trapped to fight bunches of enemies, even more as this edition forces to also use the Intenso power - not like it's not fun, but I'd have liked for combat encounters to flow a bit better.

It's really not much compared to how fun the game was as a whole, Maybe it's a case of putting the sequel among the next games to finally play, while waiting for Blighted... I played it a while ago on another PC/account and 100% completed it. Itâ€™s an amazing and incredibly fun game.
short_description: The definitive version of the smash-hit Metroidvania-style action-platformer, Guacamelee! STCE adds new levels, powers, challenges, and refinements to the sprawling, ridiculous, Mexican-inspired adventure of the original Guacamelee! Gold Edition.

short_description: The biggest first-person action series of all time and the follow-up to critically acclaimed Call of DutyÂ®: Modern Warfare 2 returns with Call of DutyÂ®: Black Ops.

name: Farthest Frontier
reviews:
This Game is worth playing, but, Very Very Slow,.  I feel it had a possibility of being much better then it is but, in order to be decent it needs to be a speed 5.  Once you learn how to play even after ten or 15 hrs, the research is like an afterthought.  As i play i like it but, i feel i am always waiting.  The resources are limited.  is it worth playing yes, but, I dont find it all that fun.  I absolutely love games with resource managment, city building, etc but, i feel this is definitely worth waiting on. Now please understand I have not fully got to the final tier.  I just lost interest because i felt waiting and waiting and waiting but not having much to do in that time leaves me just wanting to quit.  I dont feel it has enough to do to hold interest to keep you wanting to progress.  because progressing has more to do with waiting then with strategy. If you like Banished, this is a better version of Banished.

However, some UI can be improved.
1) Combat System can be improved further
2) The way curved roads / roads are being build
3) Farms - fields don't show in detail what disease there is
4) Taxes via the market system is quite whacked 

Overall, it is a very chill game to spend some time on this Yet another village building game where AI is so ignorant they will starve with food a block away rotting in a root cellar.....  I love these types of games but am tired of the worthless citizens who can't be bothered to simply grab food right next to them.  Another punishing start where you need to google countless videos to understand what level of ignorant citizens you are dealing with.  Well, these folks need super micromanaged beyond the fun micromanaging most look for.  Those who like this game likely spent a day just googling videos of people who don't work for a living to copy the very linier game play that is making these types of games die in my opinion.  Watching food rot as you have creation, distribution and proximity.... Back to uninstalling this one just like I did with Ostriv.
short_description: Protect and guide your people as you forge a town from untamed wilderness at the edge of the known world. Harvest raw materials, hunt, fish and farm to survive. Produce crafted items to trade, consume, equip and fight with as you battle for your survival against the elements and outside threats.

name: Sekiroâ„¢: Shadows Die Twice - GOTY Edition
reviews: 10/10 Try It, It's Not That Hard Lil Bro very fun game it made me want to throw my self through a ten story window perfect game nonetheless.
short_description: Game of the Year - The Game Awards 2019 Best Action Game of 2019 - IGN Carve your own clever path to vengeance in the award winning adventure from developer FromSoftware, creators of Bloodborne and the Dark Souls series. Take Revenge. Restore Your Honor. Kill Ingeniously.

genres: Action, Adventure, Massively Multiplayer, RPG, Free To Play
name: Secret World Legends
reviews: I love this conspiracy-laden urban fantasy MMO, and I only wish I had more time and more friends to play it. Great stuff, deserves all the love it can get. It is and always has been a guilty pleasure. if you make another make it with gameplay (without base building and stuff) of Dune awakening and more coop and single-player RPG like. i feel that would make this series shine more. i think the issue with this was the fact its a mmo. but i try to play like its not and its fine to me. investigations are awesome and story is amazing This is a criminally underrated MMO. It might not be at the hight of the current trends in that genre and, tbf, "MM" of the MMO is fairly limited due to the player numbers not being what they used to be. It is also much more accessible than the original "Secret World" and it is managed by Funcom (whatever that means to people). So why the thumbs-up? Because it has by far the coolest atmosphere of any MMO I have ever played. It has some of the best quests of any game I have ever played. You do have filler quests here as well, but the Action and - in particular - the investigation missions are absolutely sublime (the game has a built in browser for a reason). I realize that this will not be everyones cup of tea, far from it in fact, but if you are not the "click-click-click-experience" kinda player and appreciate cutscenes with excellent voice actors, exquisite subtle humour, an eye for details and *brutally* difficult riddles to solve I would recommend to give it a try.
short_description: Secret World Legends is a story-driven, shared-world action RPG that plunges players into a shadowy war against the supernatural, where ancient myths and legends cross over into the modern day.

reviews: RIP AND TEAR!!!!!!!!!! its just too good to not play Doom 2016 is almost as good a Brutal Chex Quest or as Doom 1 playing on a pregnancy test.  Yes, Doom in all of it's glory.  It runs incredibly well and one day it too will be able to play on everything from your car's entertainment system to your fridge.  So get ready to rip and tear!

name: Dead Rising 3 Apocalypse Edition
reviews:
Storys awesome, multiplayer is fun (when the other player isnt disconnecting), the creativity of the combo weapons is awesome, and the story is pretty cool. (this game is also a very nastolgic game!).
 Dead Rising 3 ruined the series by turning it into a generic "do whatever" open world game. Dead Rising is a time management game fundamentally, with zombies and goofy weapons added in to either aid, slow, or distract you from your objective. You had to avoid zombies, and only kill when necessary. You got better by improving your knowledge of the mall and weapons, learning tons of new things every playthrough.
DR3 on the other hand drops the time management aspect altogether and now rewards you for goofing off. It's easy from the start. You "get better" by choosing levels in a skill tree, becoming an unkillable god at the end. This contrasts with everything else in this game. The aesthetics, theme, and music are the most serious this series has ever been but you are actively encouraged to do the unserious stuff. Intense music will ramp up when a horde approaches you, as if it will be a stressful and dangerous battle between your survival and the time, however your weapons are designed to plow through hundreds, zombies are designed to be fodder, and the lenient time limit may as well not exist. The visuals and mechanics are completely opposed to each other. Not that it would be any better if it were synchronized. All that's left is the dopamine excretion from mindlessly killing zombies for no reason.
They continued this format into DR4 and made it even worse somehow, and DR5 leaked footage showed they learned nothing. This is where the fall of Dead Rising as a series began. Rest in peace.

Also, this PC port cannot be played above 60 fps without control issues, desyncs and crashes in co-op, and needs mods to fix FOV. à¹€à¸à¸¡à¸­à¸¢à¹ˆà¸²à¸‡à¸®à¸²
short_description: Explore the zombie-infested city of Los Perdidos, and find a way to escape before a military strike wipes the entire city, and everyone in it, off the map.

name: Far CryÂ®
reviews:
still fun after 21 years game still looks good and story is pretty cool After i finished this game, my armpits were sweaty. It took a couple decades to finally burn through this game completely and yes I can recommend it.

I intentionally played on easy because I knew about its infamous difficulty. Without question, the game on easy was the hardest fps campaign I've ever played through, period. Even though I gave a thumbs up, the game's difficulty was so vicious that it nearly crossed the line from being fun over into lame territory (not fun). 

___

I did play this on Linux Mint and had to do some tweaking with the mouse sensitivity. Also used the farout widescreen mod which helped with 3440x1440 res.
short_description: A tropical paradise seethes with hidden evil in Far CryÂ®, a cunningly detailed action shooter that pushes the boundaries of combat to shocking new levels. Freelance mariner Jack Carver is cursing the day he ever came to this island.

love it

short_description: The most realistic hunting experience awaits. Explore 12 reserves and hunt 45 unique species, ranging from waterfowl to big game. Over 100 weapons from state-of-the art rifles to bows. Customize your load-out with stands, blinds and dogs. Play alone or in multiplayer with up to 7 friends.

name: Sherlock Holmes: The Devil's Daughter
reviews:
It just gets better and better! Excited to play the next two games!!! Sherlock Holmes: The Devilâ€™s Daughter follows a darker, more personal story, mixing investigation with a heavier focus on atmosphere and narrative. You still solve cases through observation and deduction, but the structure feels more linear than some of the earlier entries.

I didnâ€™t like this one as much. It felt slower overall, and the pacing didnâ€™t always hold my attention the way Crimes & Punishments did. While it still has solid moments and that familiar Sherlock tone, it didnâ€™t quite capture the same sharp, satisfying detective feeling for me. [h1] Overall = 4/10[/h1]

Itâ€™s too different from the rest of the series, almost making it a parody instead of a proper Holmesâ€™ game.

Itâ€™s fun to play as the other characters in Holmesâ€™ universe, but it does make the game feel bitty, as do the short cases and quick pacing.  The cases have too many nonsensical time-fillers instead of good puzzles and whilst some do fit in with the style of being an amateur detective, they arenâ€™t particularly good or challenging.  The stories are poorly written and feel rushed, jumping from the initial investigation into poorly implemented action scenes, then onto you having to make a conclusion without the necessary steps in between.  The mind-palace tool where you draw together clues to make said conclusions is clunky to use and like a lot of the game, is a case of style over substance. Solving the cases ends up needing giant leaps of logic where overlooking the smallest of details can bring you to a wrong conclusion and connecting the dots to get the right conclusions can be painful.  The London settings are good with lots of little details to make them feel like real places and the rousing music adds to the frequent action scenes, but the character models are a bit more hit and miss in their design.  The little touches and humour in the dialogue and mannerisms of Holmes and Watson are entertaining, but itâ€™s one of the few good things about this game.
short_description: Experience a fantastic adventure with unique gameplay that blends investigation, action and exploration in a breath-taking thriller that will test the limits of your nerves and intelligence. Play as the great detective and track down evil in the darkest corners of London and the human soulâ€¦

name: Assassin's CreedÂ® Syndicate
reviews: It's okay This is a decent game, however I have many gripes with it. Although I would reccommend it for someone going through all of the games, there are issues I take with it. The first, and most frustrating one, is likely the direction they took this game in, and the creative choices. The decision to have a light hearted, comedy centred game set in the victorian era is baffling, the design of the world would have fit a much darker and serious story much more than what was the actual end result. The parkour in this game was slowed down by the world layout, and whilst being almost the exact same as the Unity system (one of the best parkour systems in the series) this one is the worst and least enjoyable system so far. A lot of the game felt like filler, having you complete a borough before you could continue or most of sequence 9 being somewhat meaningless in the grand scheme of things. Though it might sound like I hate this game, I do think its decent, far from my favourite of the Assassins Creed games, probably my least favourite so far, but I do like it. The more Hitman esq missions were nice, having a much more open ended structure to them, I'd love to see these return, I'm not sure if they exist past this game, however if they don't, its a damn shame. The actual artstyle of this game is phenomenal, as I said, if the tone was darker, and the world was more dense and suitable for parkour, the game would have been so much better, however we are only left with the really cool looking visuals the world portrays. I feel like the reason I didn't enjoy my time with this game as much as I should have might be because of the fact that by the end I just wanted to beat the game as it was taking me way too long. The fact that I was trying to play through all of these games made me feel like I had to beat this, and I just wanted it done with by the end. I'm thinking of doing things a little more casually for the next few games, but for now I am finished with the classic AC games. Lowkey very similar to irl London people jumping off roofs and stabbing each other
short_description: London, 1868. Lead your underworld organization in the midst of the Industrial Revolution to break the corrupt stranglehold on the city in a visceral adventure filled with action, intrigue, and brutal combat.

name: World War 3
reviews: Shovel ware garbage, first match after installing a terrible 3rd party launcher and my soldier is already getting stuck on carpets and struggling to walk around pebbles Sad to see what was a really fun game crash and burn so bad as this did.Ive played this game since its relaunch when it was paid and it was top notch quality and fun but now As of typing this out, only 19 people are playing this game and it hasnt reached a 100 players for over 3 months now and when i go to try and search for a tactical ops gamemode lobby, its forces me into a stronghold match with nothing but bots and maybe one or two other people. there has been no significant content updates for months now and theres absolutely no lobbies to play and enjoy anymore. I would say i hope this game has a revival but this was supposed to be the revival and it absolutely failed. If this continues on in this state then i cant recommend this to anyone at all even as a free game but, if the devs can bring this game back from the dead, then i would say to pick this up and play if there are lobbies then to join and not small tdm bot matches to be forced into. I definitely would not recommend this video game. The graphics were decent but the controls were lackluster. The online community is extreme hostile and negative towards new gamers. Unless you're playing COD, BF or Halo, most of these multiplayer FPS games are just money grabs. When I first got WW3, I don't remember the cost but there was a charge for it. Now it's free to play. Stay clear! Go play ARMA 3 or The Finals or something else.
short_description: World War 3 is a free-to-play tactical online multiplayer FPS where the world is your battleground. Outgun the enemy in thrilling, team-based skirmishes with a huge arsenal of weapons, vehicles, gadgets, and drones at your disposal.

name: The Tiny Bang Story
reviews:
I really enjoyed this game. I played it in 7 hours i like the gentle pretty music and finding the items. I absolutely love this game! The artsyle is really charmingâ€”plus the music; the atmosphere makes it a place I'd wanna live in lowkey! It's easy to pick up and play anytime aswell due to it's simple and intuitive gameplay. Honestly the only thing I don't like about it (and this being a shared sentiment) is that it's quite a short game, with no extra content or sequels.. </3 Even still though, it can be nice to replay it after a long while!â€”So it can still be enjoyed even after being finished despite no sequels or anything! Not worth $5 US. But maybe worth $1 or $2. Unless you really, really like just finding stuff on a low resolution screen. It was a little bit fun. Mostly you just have to find many of a certain object across 3-4 scenes. There are some little mini-puzzles. Some it was totally not clear what you were supposed to do, what the final outcome was supposed to be.

There are no hints and you can't skip puzzles. I had to put resolution to 1280x720 manually. The mouse had a black square around it.

reviews: As someone who grew up playing luigi's mansion for the gamecube, I never realized the direct inspiration it had taken from this game! While I had a couple issues, like finding ammo to be almost too scarce at times (more of a me issue), and had some issues with the lack of movement options, I think this game was incredibly well-paced and gave me a few good scares! Will definitely revisit this game in the future (especially to take a look at the game's plethora of side content), and I would absolutely recommend this game! Adochka, youâ€™re beautiful â¤ï¸â€ðŸ”¥ leon
short_description: A deadly virus engulfs the residents of Raccoon City in September of 1998, plunging the city into chaos as flesh eating zombies roam the streets for survivors. An unparalleled adrenaline rush, gripping storyline, and unimaginable horrors await you. Witness the return of Resident Evil 2.

genres: Action, Adventure, Casual, Massively Multiplayer, RPG, Free To Play
name: Trove
reviews: tr just game to start of with with new friends or old friends really chill game and dosent make u rage and is really fun to start if u just got a pc so awesome
short_description: Grab your friends, hone your blades, and set off for an epic procedurally generated adventure in Trove! Battle the Shadow in realms filled with dungeons and items created by your fellow players. Whether hunting treasure or building realms of your own, itâ€™s never been this good to be square!

name: The Walking Dead: Season Two
reviews:
peak perfect Wow. Serenely beautiful.

A very different vibe to S1. Clem is tougher, and I liked seeing Lee's teachings and habits show through in her.
God I did miss Lee.

[spoiler]Finding Kenny through was great, and I was glad I could make it to the end with him, opting not to go into Wellington.[/spoiler]

A very, very good, depressing, and captivating game, which I hope A New Frontier can build off of.
short_description: The Walking Dead: Season Two continues the story of Clementine, a young girl orphaned by the undead apocalypse. Left to fend for herself, she has been forced to learn how to survive in a world gone mad.

short_description: Don the mask and join the Phantom Thieves of Hearts as they stage grand heists, infiltrate the minds of the corrupt, and make them change their ways!

name: Subnautica: Below Zero
reviews:
It's like Subnautica but slightly disappointing. A less magical version. If you can't get enough Subnautica buy it, preferably on sale.

If you only played the first game once this might not be a good purchase for you.

 Fishy Beautiful, stimulating environment; open, engaging plot with a leisurely pace.
short_description: Dive into a freezing underwater adventure on an alien planet. Below Zero is set two years after the original Subnautica. Return to Planet 4546B to uncover the truth behind a deadly cover-up. Survive by building habitats, crafting tools, & diving deeper into the world of Subnautica.

name: Tropico 4
reviews:
â­ 10/10 â€“ Banana Republic Simulator: Now With More Dictatorship â­

Tropico 4 is everything youâ€™ve ever wanted in a city-builder: sunny beaches, corrupt politicians, and the sweet satisfaction of telling your citizens exactly how to liveâ€¦ or not, depending on bribes.

El Presidente has never felt so powerful. Build, tax, spy, or outright manipulate your way to glory while juggling elections, riots, and random hurricanes like a true tyrant. The humor is sharp, the advisors are delightfully sarcastic, and thereâ€™s nothing quite like the joy of executing a plot twist in your favor while everyone else panics.

The sandbox is highly replayable, the scenarios are fun, and the soundtrack makes you feel like youâ€™re genuinely running a tropical dictatorship, sombrero optional but recommended.

If you like management, satire, and ruthless political strategies disguised as city planning, Tropico 4 is a tropical paradise of chaos.

Highly recommended. Build your empire, and remember: democracy is optional. Amazing music, Relaxing, Great 360 building, Fun building, funny characters (voices). I love being el Presidente After so many years,  this game is still one of the best tropico  games. Funny, casual and in many ways based on actual  events and people. Some quotes and missions used in a game were real. As someone who  was born in socialistic country, spent part of childhood in it, can  confirm  that some slogans used in game are real. Quotes which  appear while game is loading or saving are real, said by actual  real people from  past. I was surprised to  see the  quote from  Josip Broz Tito which he  said to Stalin, years after he refused Stalin's proposal that former Yugoslavia joins SSSR.  I will  always recommend this game to anyone, especialy with  all dlcs and modern  times expansion.
short_description: The world is changing and Tropico is moving with the times - geographical powers rise and fall and the world market is dominated by new players with new demands and offers - and you, as El Presidente, face a whole new set of challenges.

name: Gear Up
reviews: While it is now a dead game, it was was an engaging game when it was popular. Very fun, ability to upgrade your tank, etc. I like the vechicle driving and customisation and environments and power ups fun easy game.  too bad
short_description: Feel the adrenaline as you control your unique tank in multiplayer arcade action! Build your ultimate war machine from over a million different combinations. Now, will you go for the rumbling caterpillar tracks or the crawling spider legs?

name: Age of Empires II: Definitive Edition
reviews: eishelente! If you're just learning about strategy games, you're in for a treat if you play it honest and don't look everything up beforehand. Otherwise, there's not really a point. I don't know about Multiplayer yet myself, but my friends promise it's fun when y'all get together and do stuff. If you DO know about strategy games, you don't need a review to tell you this is a classic game that does most of this stuff right. Go on now, play your game. Have some fun. When I play RTS games I play the campaign mostly. I tried a few campaigns in this game and I have to say they are more difficult than Starcraft 2 and Warcraft 3. I dislike that the starting map for the first mission of the 3 different campaigns I tried, my base could be attacked from 4 sides. Also the game is heavy on rock-paper-scissors kind of combat. Many RTS games have that but here is over the top. So for instance, archers are sort of useless  versus battering rams and archers are totally helpless against cavalry. For comparison, In Starcraft 2, there are also rock-paper-scissors but not the point of units being completely helpless versus some specific units  like in this game. So why I recommend it? because its a solid and in-depth RTS game. Also, the game have a tutorial campaign that introduces the basic elements.
short_description: 42 Civilizations, 229 Campaign Missions, Singleplayer, Co-Op, Multiplayer, In-Game Editor, Mods, Cross-play...It is good to be the king.

name: Warhammer 40,000: Darktide
reviews:
this game is lowkey fire i love the theme and the hordes that swarm you it has finally gotten to be as good as vermintide 1 and 2 are game fun, lore complicated.


10/10 recommend.
short_description: Take back the city of Tertium from hordes of bloodthirsty foes in this intense and brutal action shooter. Warhammer 40,000: Darktide is the new co-op focused experience from the award-winning team behind the Vermintide series. As Tertium falls, Rejects Will Rise.

name: How to Survive
reviews:
I've spent quite a bit of time surviving on the zombie-infested islands of How to Survive, and I have to say, this game is way more fun than I expected. At first glance, it might seem like just another top-down zombie survival game, but it manages to mix action, crafting, survival mechanics, and co-op in a way that's surprisingly engaging.

The story is simple: you're stranded on a series of tropical islands after a shipwreck, and your main goal is to survive while uncovering the mysteries of the archipelago. Honestly, the plot isn't groundbreaking - it's mostly a framework of justify exploration and combat - but it works well enough. The islands feel varied, from dense forests and rocky shores to small villages and hidden caves. Each area has different zombie types, environmental hazards, and supplies, which keeps exploration from feeling repetitive.

[h2] Why I keep coming back [/h2]

Despite its flaws, this game has a charm that keeps me coming back. The mix of crafting, combat, and exploration is addictive. I loved experimenting with combinations of traps and weapons, seeing which ones were overpowered, and finding ways to make zombie hordes more manageable (or just more chaotic).

Even though the story isn't memorable, the atmosphere and tension keep the islands exciting. You never quite know what zombie variant you'll encounter next, and the feeling of finally surviving a particularly difficult island with limited supplies is incredibly satisfying.

Playing with a friend amplifies the fun even more. We'd coordinate traps, share supplies, and try crazy stunts just for laughs. The game manages to make zombie survival both tense and silly at the same time, which is a rare combination.

[h2] Combat and Gameplay [/h2]

Combat in How to Survive is fast-paced and fun, particularly with ranged weapons. Crafting bows, guns, or throwing explosives feels satisfying, especially when you use the environment strategically. Traps and improvised explosives and another layer of creativity - sometimes it's more fun to set a trap and watch zombies destroy themselves than to fight them head-on.

Melee combat is serviceable but can feel clunky at times, especially when facing large groups of zombies. Still, the game encourages creative problem-solving: running straight at zombies is often a bad idea, so using traps, ranged weapons, and the environment is not only more effective, it's more fun.

Exploration is engaging as well. Each island has hidden resources, crafting materials, and side objectives. Sometimes I would just wander around to scavenge and see what crazy combos I could make, which added hours of replayability. The game rewards curiosity - you never know what supplies or interesting zombies you'll find around the next corner.

[h2] Conclusion [/h2]

How to Survive is a solid zombie survival adventure that balances action, crafting etc. It's not a hardcore survival simulator, but it scratches the survival itch without overwhelming you. The crafting system is incredibly rewarding, combat is fun, and local co-op turns the experience into a chaotic, hilarious, and surprisingly strategic adventure

If you enjoy zombie games, crafting and experimenting with creative ways to survive, this is definitely a title worth trying. The campaign may be short, and the story forgettable, but the sheer joy of crafting weapons, setting traps, and outsmarting zombie makes it memorable. Whether you're going solo or with a friend, there's a lot of fun to be had.

9 of 10
 review its the best fun zombie game ever

With a surprisingly deep crafting systemâ€ â€“ GamesRadarYou're shipwrecked on an isolated island, a desperate castaway in a total freakshow world. How will you survive?

name: Warhammer 40,000: Rogue Trader
reviews:
found out a bunch of refugees were being kept in line by sedative gas being pumped in over the air filtration system. Response to serial suicides was to give them even more sedatives. this was one of the least bad options. good game After having heard of Owlcat's issues repeatedly I was a bit concerned about trying out this one, especially since I am not super into Warhammer, but ... I absolutely love it. First 30 hours feels like a tutorial, ended up getting 160 hours from my first playthrough and can see myself playing again because it sure feels like there's a *ton* of choices to make with meaningful impact. Tons of items, lots of characters, way more different ways to play it than I expected.

It can be a bit overwhelming at times, when you have to level up multiple characters and try to scroll through the list of 100 choices for each of them again, but if you write down all the interesting things per character towards what goal you want to reach, it gets easier.

Combat is great, story is actually interesting, lots of side-quests, and in general many layers of gameplay. I beat BG3 on Honor Mode after 350 Hours, but this game is already better than BG3 for me. How you wonder? The writing is so strikingly good, what does the writing do you ask? It makes the dialogues, choices, the consequences very enjoyable to immersive myself in as a Rogue Trader.
short_description: Made in a close partnership with Games Workshop, Warhammer 40,000: Rogue Trader is a story-rich classical RPG from Owlcat Games, developers of the critically acclaimed game, Pathfinder: Wrath of the Righteous.

name: Homefront
reviews:
Short but awesome campaign Its short 3 hour campaign. Its good well paced little janky at times but overall very solid story experience. worht on sale for sure. Homefront 
Playtime: 22 hours 
Achievements: 47/47 (100%)

What really sticks with me about this game is the lore â€” North Korea rising into a global threat, the world spiraling into warâ€¦ itâ€™s fictional, sure, but with the way the real world feels these days, the premise hits a little too close for comfort.

I remember hearing about this one back in the PS3 era â€” pretty sure it even had that â€œPlatinumâ€ label â€” but I never gave it much attention at the time. Jump in now, and the first ten minutes already make a statement. For a game released in 2011, itâ€™s shockingly sharp. The visuals still carry weight, and the weapon sounds? Genuinely impressive.

I played through the campaign twice to finish everything on the hardest difficulty, Guerrilla, and thatâ€™s where things go from â€œintenseâ€ to â€œgood luck, soldier.â€ Itâ€™s a rough climb, but a fun one.

Overall, itâ€™s a strong, memorable game. If youâ€™re thinking about buying it, do it for the message, the world it builds, and the way it delivers its story. If I were rating it, Iâ€™d easily call it a 10 and... RIP Connor.

name: Control Ultimate Edition
reviews:
hella scp vibes, i love the supernatural aspect behind closed doors and not available to the public type of game, game is fun and i hope to enjoy the second game once it comes out next year Let me say this first, if you are going into this game and want the gameplay to be amazing then there will be some slight problems with it. The gun you are given gets dramatically overshadowed by the first ability you come across and even with upgrades it will still be not as good as just throwing stuff at people. Then there's the fact that this game has a loot system. Thankfully it is not anything drastic like getting a completely different weapon or armor since that would greatly remove the immersion the game is going for, but it still is something that you should at least slightly pay attention to make the game not shred you. This I feel distracts you from the games much more appealing story and world that it is a little annoying that it is even there but that's most likely a personal gripe than anything.

With that said though, this game is genuinely a treat. Never has a game made me actively seek out lore and parts of the facility and be happy to explore it to its fullest and there is still stuff I did not find even with typing this and 100% the game. This makes it such an immersive game that even though you are flying around controlling peoples minds and throwing stuff at enemies it feels apart of the world more than it takes you out. I feel that's hard to do especially with the gameplay this game has and it does such a good job with it. So many moments will stick out to me even way after I played this game.

The main story is honestly better than I thought when I played this on console a while back and although I think some dialogue with Jesse can be a little cringe, its hard to write dialogue for a character that sees the craziest thing happen and it doesn't just boil down to "huh a flying tv is not something you see everyday." Thankfully its good enough to feel a little more realistic and doesn't just sound like it came out of a marvel movie. 

This game is like an 8/10, if the gameplay was improved a bit more this would be practically a perfect game in my eyes. Trash map
Trash combat
Trash loot system
Trash heroine (cant even move the mouth in conversations LOL)

Looks good but youre just going through this atrocious offiice with useless combat abilities trying to understand this obscure story via 2000 pieces of paper lying around. Get flushed garbage.

name: Call of Duty: World at War
reviews:
it's a good game for 2025-2026 it's just online not the best playable but  zombies is fun thought Call of Duty World At War deserves eminence positivity with reasons to come. 

Caution!!!
Do not attempt to play any sort online mode without installing a mod client. If attempting to do so can result in severe security risks. Only play through private or mod client dedicated servers.

Campaign:
The game portrays the WWII setting very well with its dark and gritty atmosphere. Also, multiple missions offer eminence adrenaline rushes; either holding out or pushing against the Japanese or Germans all while the blood pumping soundtrack plays. The gameplay is classic and grounded similar to older Call of Duty titles (2003-2012), no slide maneuvers or ridiculous movement exploits. The game holds many memorable characters such as (Reznov, Private C. Miller, Dimitri, Polonsky, Roebuck, Chernov, and others). The experience truly unfolds when engaging with friends, or co-op.

Multiplayer:
Never had the desire to engage in multiplayer. Manly due to empty servers and the repetitive nature of this mode, yet this is only my personal preferences.

Zombies:
The first Call of Duty title to feature a zombies mode. Includes the four classic maps (Nacht Der Untoten, Verruct, Shi No Numa, Der Riese). Although, only containing four maps; more can be installed through mods. Truly a phenomenal experience with friends.

Conclusion: 
If you desire the old classic Call of Duty games, authentic historical shooter, or only zombies. I can recommend this. 67
short_description: Call of Duty is back, redefining war like you've never experienced before. Building on the Call of Duty 4Â®: Modern Warfare engine, Call of Duty: World at War immerses players into the most gritty and chaotic WWII combat ever experienced.

name: DUSK
reviews:
Just buy it. It's a bargain even at full price.  The creativity in level design, along with the smooth mechanics of a modern game engine, make Dusk a top-tier FPS.  Scratch that - Dusk is a top-tier game, period. DUSK is a Boomer Shooter and an amazing one at that, mimicking the look of old classics like DOOM or Turok but with modern QoL features.

The game's level design is honestly great, I was able to find most secrets by looking around myself instead of consulting a quide and I seldom felt lost.

The enemy variety is quite nice as well. The first half of episode one felt a bit weak because of the lack of any really dangerous enemies but this is fixed in all the later levels in the game.

One of my only gripes is the fact that you get access to all the weapons in the game within the first episode with no new ones to be seen at all. Would've been nice to get a few more in the later levels, like a chain gun or somekind of demonic weapon. 7.5/10

No easily conceivable story, but just lots of interesting levels dripping with atmosphere and hordes of demonic baddies. Weapons all feel weighty and useful. Classic 8-bit graphics, but tons of options to smooth out the pixels or make it even more pixelated. Repetitive, but fun and worth the cheap price of admission.
short_description: Battle through an onslaught of mystical backwater cultists, possessed militants & even darker forces as you attempt to discover just what lurks beneath the Earth in this retro FPS inspired by the '90s legends.

I look forward to when then add steam mod support. It has the usual amount of grind with the usual amount of reward; there needs to be a way to unlock advanced starts once you have made it to a high store level and want to start over without repeating the grind. For the time being, mods can help you give yourself a head start. If you like this genre, you will like this game.

name: Victoria 3
reviews: THis is a completely biased & unrealistic politicly corrupt game I've ever seen. The literal unAmerica politic landslide biased in it is offensive. I'll never play it again. Glad I didn't pay the original price for it. The liberal landslide tilt to this no matter what country you play is hilariously offensive. It's almost completely BS false nothing seems factual at all including so called historic figures. In one game I played Cornelius Vanderbilt his bio listed him as a slave owner as was supposably General & later US president Grant I don't recall ever hearing either of them slave owners or anything of the sort. US Grant was a Northern General of all things during the USA civil war. Flawed as he was its a pretty known fact he was a Northern General. In the game of the USA I played it said he was a slaver & a slave owner. At one point a someone ran away & it said he wanted them back & you must pick to return the wanted person or not. If you don't there's always an uprising by abolutionists & whigs party. Which from history & many documenties say that's completely wrong.  On top of the insane political bias the micro-management you have to do to whatever country or region you play is let alone if you grow is insane. I don't expect a game to be accurate or always factual but this is crazy. Another thing if you have a surplus to long & a thriving economy you get punished & there's uprisings if someone is broke or has terroritory you can't even try to buy it without the exact right circumstances even if you have plenty of money in the reserves of your country. I played as France & tried to give independence to colonies which at the time of the start were low on wanting independence so they rose up against me I did similar as the UK & even the Dutch same thing.  I'm not trying to get all political no group has ever been perfect or fair & these days are no different let alone in the past but this game just seems so openly biased. No matter what country or type of government you play as it always seems that liberals or progressives are the ones most often victims of  "riots" & attacks. Anyways I'm out $15 bucks but that's fine i'm done with this game. it has SO MANY bugs and stupid Ai behaviours that must be fixed for ex when a major power suddenly get its economy collapsed after 1 war and unable to recover for the rest of the game and many other stupid stuff, but its still one of the best games ive played in my life as a history/economy fan An Amazing Political and Economic simulator. The game ties the systems of the economy a nations domestic politics and diplomacy together very well. Unfortunately the warfare system is very simple and oftentimes seems unfair or rng based. all In all Victoria 3 Is one of my favorite games

Balance the competing interests in your society and earn your place in the sun in Victoria 3, one of the most anticipated games in Paradoxâ€™s history.

name: Divinity: Original Sin 2 - Definitive Edition
reviews: Lizard feet Fun! Game is unfortunately bogged down by its own inadequacy. Every single fight in the game involves fire or poison, there are no good weapons or items to find, all of your characters feel weak or useless and every encounter results in a party member dying. When I have to turn a game down to the easiest difficulty because its been encounter after encounter where I'm outnumbered, outgunned and under leveled, and all I've been trying to do is explore the game world around me, that tells me that the game is adversarial to me actually playing it. If I spend a chunk of time trying to loot every chest and storage space possible and almost always turn up empty handed, it makes the game feel vapid and empty. If one of the first puzzles I encounter breaks immediately, on account of me accidentally killing an NPC before realizing he was essential, and I soft lock myself, that tells me the puzzles weren't well thought out. I do not need to waste my time trying to grind through dogshit to reach some part of the story that might be good or some weapon I might like. It lacks charm and diversity, and unfortunately its only appeal- the very cool world and story- plays a backseat to tedium and disadvantage.

name: FEZ
reviews:
FEZ starts out as a promising game with its unique perspective mechanic and charming visuals, but eventually devolves into a frustrating slog towards the end.

The goal of FEZ is to collect enough cubes to beat the game. These are acquired by platforming and solving puzzles. There are golden cubes, anti cubes, maps, and some more collectibles tied to the hardest puzzles in the game (not mentioning for spoilers).

The first half of the game mainly consists of collecting the golden cubes, and maybe some anti cubes along the way. The golden cubes start out incredibly simple, and barely require any critical thinking. I thought these would get more complex as the game progressed, but sadly that is not the case. They retain a similar amount of complexity for the entire game. Most of the challenge for these cubes comes from the platforming, very little puzzle solving is required. 

Well if the golden cubes donâ€™t have much to offer, surely the anti cubes are where the interesting puzzles are at? Right? 

Yes and no. Only some of the anti cubes I would classify as good puzzles. Iâ€™m referring to all of the anti cubes you can solve on your first encounter (except the Clock Tower, if you know, you know). 

The reason I specified â€œfirst encounterâ€ is due to the fact that a significant amount of the anti cubes are impossible to solve without understanding the biggest mystery FEZ has to offer. Now Iâ€™m not going to spoil what the mystery is (even though this game is over a decade old), but what I will say is that figuring it out is the best part of FEZ. The sheer euphoria you feel is incredible, and completely changes how you view the game moving forward.

Unfortunately, right after this point, this is where I really started to hate FEZ. I have two reasons why.

1. The backtracking. Like I said earlier, a lot of the anti cubes cannot be solved your first time around, so youâ€™re intended to backtrack. While the map is very clear about which rooms contain unsolved puzzles, the problem is figuring out HOW to get back to a specific room. Basically devolves into a big game of guess and check. It doesnâ€™t help that the movement is sluggish as well.
2. The puzzles. My problem is that too many of the puzzles tied to the big mystery of FEZ feel too similar, you repeat the same set of actions over and over again. Itâ€™s not uncommon for a puzzle to be repeated with almost no variation. There are some notable exceptions which shake up the formula, but not enough.

FEZ is a cool concept with moments of brilliance, but as a game, itâ€™s just not fun. Incredible first impression, would love to explore it further It's fun puzzle and platform game. And it's really astonishing to solve the secret on my own paces. Worth the time.
short_description: Gomez is a 2D creature living in a 2D world. Or is he? When the existence of a mysterious 3rd dimension is revealed to him, Gomez is sent out on a journey that will take him to the very end of time and space. Use your ability to navigate 3D structures from 4 distinct classic 2D perspectives.

name: Back to Bed
reviews:
weird Brilliant Concept for a Puzzle game. I was not expecting to enjoy this game. I certainly liked the idea of the puzzle mechanics, which is why I bought it several years ago (probably on sale), but every time since buying it that I've looked at it and considered playing it, it didn't win my interest enough to actually open it. Well, I've just opened it due to random game selection and it turns out, I actually love it.

At first, I didn't like it at all. The ambiance is bizarre and uncomfortable, the voiceover is robotic, the creature you play as is this little four-legged dog-like animal with the face of a man... it's fucking weird. But it quickly grew on me. It really sets the tone effectively and, once you allow the really weird things to bleed into the background while you focus on your task, it creates a very interesting and intense atmosphere that I appreciate.

The things I liked about the game:
[*]It was short and sweet. It did what it came here to do and didn't artificially extend itself so much that I got tired of playing.
[*]The puzzle mechanics are simple but provide enough challenge to keep you engaged.
[*]There is no penalty for letting Bob fall off the ledge over and over. If you need a minute to look at the puzzle and consider, or set up some of the pieces in various places, you can do that without concern for if Bob is falling off the ledge or not. The pieces only reset to their starting locations if you actually let Bob get killed by one of the four hazards present in certain levels.
[*]The voiceover says a lot of weird things that were often entertaining and have, in some cases, memeified themselves in my head after hearing them so many times. (I played through 4 times on normal and once in nightmare mode, which I'll explain below)

The things I didn't like so much:
[*]Most, or maybe every time I tabbed out of the game, I tabbed back in to find it black and unresponsive, even though the audio kept going as normal. I had to force it closed via Steam and reopen it.
[*]The menu was a little janky and unresponsive sometimes. I found I had to frequently click A on my controller twice to get menu buttons to respond. Maybe they all do that intentionally. If so, why? If not, bug.
[*]On at least one level, I had a really annoying experience with the object highlights. Typically whichever item you're facing will highlight for you to grab. In this particular level, there were a fish and apple that needed to be next to each other, and when I would try to  grab the fish to move it, the apple would be difficult to get past. It ended up being easier on many occasions to simply move the apple at mach speed before moving the fish where I needed to, rather than try to fight it. This was only an annoyance on one level though and it was easily worked around.
[*]The worst offense of all, however, is that multi-step achievements must be done in one session, and must be done in a fresh session if failed before. The two that this occurred with were the one for making him die to all 4 hazards (each of these must be done in the same single session), and the Speedrunner achievement. So, I played the entire game in one go the first time I played it. It took about an hour. The Speedrunner achievement necessitates completing the first 30 levels (the span of the game on Normal mode) in 45 minutes, so I needed to do it again. I did it again. I did not get the achievement. I hadn't looked at the clock so, even though it hadn't seemed like that long, I guessed I must have gone just slightly over. I looked at the clock and did it again. No achievement even though I did it in 25 minutes. I looked at the discussion board, wondering if it was broken, only to find that this dumbass game only counts your speed from the moment you open the game or some nonsense. If you finish the game in 50 minutes, it must have in its temp files that your first attempt at level 1 was when you first played it that session and then it will not overwrite that unless you close the game and reopen it. So guess who had to close the game, reopen, and play through it a 4th time. Fortunately, by the 4th time, I was very practiced and it only took 17 minutes but it was still annoying. Granted, becoming very familiar helped with the nightmare mode levels, which are the same but require gathering keys to unlock the bedroom door before you can finish the level. Anyway, I digress. This is a terrible way to save speedrunning progress. Every time you open up level one should reset your speedrunning progress, or each level's last start time should be saved separately, and if all of them are started and finished within a 45 minute time span, it counts, even if they're out of order, or something. This is not it.
[*]And one additional achievement offense is the Elitist achievement, wherein you must open the game at 13:37. I'm not going to get into the jankiness of the achievement triggering, partially because I had no trouble getting it to trigger, but the discussion boards reveal plenty of issues with that as well. My main issues with this achievement are that it adds nothing, it reveals nothing, it achieves nothing, it has nothing to do with the game, and it requires returning - in some people's cases, for several days to retry obtaining it - after game completion. This kind of achievement is no big deal, and can be kind of funny, in big games that require dozens or hundred of hours of gameplay, because you get it by accident at some point and it's just kind of a surprise. This game is a one-sitting kind of game. If you play it in the evening, you're required to come back at a specific time - put it in your damn schedule to come back - so you can get this nothing-achievement. It's annoying and pointless. End rant.

All in all, if you're not precious about a few bucks, it's worth buying at its full price of 6 francs (5 bucks?), but it on sale for 1 during seasonal sales, like right now. I probably bought it on sale and of course recommend waiting for one yourself, but if you're really into it and can't wait, I don't think 6 francs is unfair or anything.

name: Thief
reviews:
Absolutely Love This Game. 
Being Able To Run Around And Do What I Want In Between Missions, All Of The Little Secrets You Can Find Everywhere. 
And We Can't Forget About Chapter 3 ;) LOL Yea this game pretty much taught me to read steam reviews before purchase. The short version: This game is hot garbage.

Letâ€™s start with the good:

(1) The stealth gameplay is decent.
There are a fair number of options for how you can approach missions, along with different tools and routes that allow for some variety in playstyle.

Thatâ€™s it.

Now for the bad:

(1) The story is absolute trash.
And I mean SSJ-level bad. I honestly donâ€™t know what the studio was thinking. It turns into this weird supernatural/virus/horror mashupâ€¦ in a Thief game. Yeah. Bonkers. It doesnâ€™t work at all. The characters are unrelatable and unlikeable, and the world itself feels flat and uninteresting. I could not be less invested in the story or anyone in it.

(2) The voice acting is terrible.
I didnâ€™t realize Garrettâ€™s longtime voice actor had been replaced, but it shows immediately. Everyone sounds completely checked out, like they just didnâ€™t care. The writing certainly doesnâ€™t help, but the performances make it even worse. Itâ€™s bad stacked on top of bad.

(3) The animations are rough and unfinished.
Lip-syncing is way off. Charactersâ€™ mouths move when thereâ€™s no dialogue and stop moving when there is. If youâ€™re expecting immersion, donâ€™tâ€”youâ€™ll be better off letting that expectation go early.

(4) Movement and interaction feel awkward.
Jumping is very limited, and there are constant loading interruptions mid-gameplay. For example, opening windows requires mashing the interact key multiple times or they just wonâ€™t openâ€”and youâ€™ll be doing this constantly. There are also tons of â€œwalk through this narrow space to hide loadingâ€ moments, often combined with more button-mashing mechanics. It gets old fast.

(5) Tonally, the game has completely lost its identity.
It feels like a high school student who didnâ€™t read the assignment and went off on a wild tangent about something totally unrelated. I was constantly thinking, â€œWhat the hell am I playing?â€â€”and not in a good or intriguing way. Youâ€™ll be looting desks while monster screams echo in the background, paired with random horror â€œBONGSâ€ that shake the screen or gray it out. Itâ€™s justâ€¦ weird, and not in a way that benefits the game.

Overall, saying Iâ€™m disappointed would be an understatement. I cannotâ€”and do notâ€”recommend this to anyone, especially fans of the original series. Iâ€™m not having fun, and Iâ€™m not enjoying my time with it, which is surprising because this studio has made enjoyable titles in the past. Unfortunately, this isnâ€™t one of them.

name: Heaven Forest - VR MMO
reviews:
Heaven Forest â€“ VR MMO is an unusual and quietly ambitious experiment, one that doesnâ€™t try to compete with traditional MMOs or high-budget VR worlds. Developed by Fabio Ferrara and published by Chubby Pixel, it invites players into a serene digital forest that serves more as a reflective space than a battleground or quest hub. The premise is simple but evocative: wander through a vast, dreamlike woodland setting, encounter mysterious ruins, discover glowing wildlife, and share the environment with others who happen to be exploring at the same time. Instead of missions or combat-driven progression, the game positions itself as a meditative journey, asking players to consider philosophical questions about existence, connection, and meaning. Itâ€™s a concept rarely explored in online gaming, giving the experience a distinct voice from its very first moments.

Gameplay unfolds at a gentle, unhurried pace. Movement, exploration, and quiet observation are the primary interactions, and the forest is designed to reward curiosity rather than challenge it. There are no enemies to defeat, no loot to collect, no leveling tracks to obsess overâ€”just winding paths, hidden alcoves, small interactive objects, and scattered messages that hint at deeper themes. Whether played in VR or on a standard display, the game encourages players to immerse themselves in its ambience, taking in the sound of wind through trees, the glow of distant lanterns, or the movement of ethereal animals drifting through the environment. The inclusion of online connectivity means that other explorers occasionally appear as wandering spirits, creating a subtle sense of companionship without forcing interaction. Itâ€™s a social experience defined by presence rather than conversation.

Visually, Heaven Forest prioritizes atmosphere over realism. The landscapes are stylized, softened by mist, filtered light, and gentle color palettes that lean into natural greens, blues, and earthy tones. Trees stretch into hazy skylines, temples and stone structures peek out from overgrowth, and surreal effects remind players that this is not an ordinary forest but a symbolic realm. The graphical fidelity reflects its indie originsâ€”textures and models may appear simple or dated compared to modern VR standardsâ€”but the overall artistic intent still comes through. Paired with calming music and subtle environmental audio, the world feels cohesive and emotionally grounded, especially when experienced through a VR headset where scale and depth enhance the feeling of drifting through a living dream.

The gameâ€™s â€œMMOâ€ designation is more thematic than literal, which may surprise players expecting traditional massively multiplayer structure. While others can be encountered, there are no guilds, markets, raids, or large-scale community events. Interaction is intentionally minimal, almost anonymous, reinforcing the idea that each player is on a personal journey rather than participating in a shared pursuit. This looseness can feel refreshing to those tired of competitive or objective-heavy online spaces, but it can also leave some players wishing for more mechanical depth or structured social systems. The experience thrives when treated as a meditative multiplayer art installation, but falters when approached as a feature-rich online RPG.

Where Heaven Forest succeeds most is in offering a space rarely found in gamingâ€”a quiet, contemplative world that values stillness, beauty, and introspection. However, these same qualities mean the game has inherent limitations. The lack of traditional gameplay loops, objectives, and progression systems may leave some players feeling directionless or disengaged. The world, while atmospheric, can feel empty at times, especially during off-hours when few other players are online. Technical limitations, simplistic visuals, and minimal interaction systems also reveal the constraints of its small-scale development. For players looking for challenge, intensity, or long-term goals, the experience may feel too slight to sustain interest.

Yet despite its imperfections, Heaven Forest remains memorable because it dares to be different. It offers a quiet refugeâ€”something closer to a virtual nature walk, a philosophical thought piece, or a shared digital meditation space than a traditional game. For those who enjoy atmospheric exploration, peaceful VR environments, or simply wandering without expectation, it provides moments of genuine calm and wonder. It works best when approached with curiosity rather than demands, letting players determine their own pace, purpose, and emotional interpretation. Heaven Forest may not appeal to everyone, but for the right audience, it offers an experience that lingers long after the headset is removed or the screen goes darkâ€”a reminder that sometimes the most meaningful journeys are the ones without objectives.

Rating: 6/10 [h2]Heaven Forest - VR MMO[/h2]

Has a total of [b]15[/b] trading cards. eyes hurt

name: Sabre Team
reviews: [i]Sabre Team[/i], the DOS version, is inferior to the AMIGA version in every way, to the point where I am unsure as to why contemporary consumers were only given the obsolete option. With that said, this version does not allow contact with terrorists if they are not in the same room as the player's units, or just outside of the door, yet the enemy AI does not have [b]any[/b] issue taking long shots at one's units from across multiple rooms and out of view, no matter if the unit is facing the direction of the fired shot or not. Even with the manual, players will struggle with the controls and mechanics, as every action costs action points and every factor must be painstakingly micromanaged, lest players be forced to reload their saves dozens of times. The most generous thing that can be said about this product is that its DOS version does it no favors whatsoever. I give it 7/10. I like it more because its a bit of an inspiration. I feel someone could greatly improve upon this excellent formula. The gameplay could use a lot of polish, the difficulty is a bit high due to the poor polish. But the art and concepts are great. I especially love the art. Sabre Team was my one of the first strategy games of my childhood and I wished there was a remake. If you like original Ufo enemy unknown (tactical missions type of game play) than you should give a go. Old school classic.
short_description: Sabre Team is an isometric squad-level turn-based infiltration simulation that lets you assemble and take command of a Sabre Team unit of four hand-picked elite S.A.S. agents as they confront delicate and dangerous scenarios involving terrorist threats and hostage situations.

name: Darksiders Warmastered Edition
reviews:
This is your dad's Zelda game. In the sense that it looks like a playable heavy metal album cover with writing akin to Warhammer and combat just like Devil May Cry. Definitely worth checking out if you miss Zelda and wish it were edgier. good hack and slash Im dead serious when I say this, this is easily top 3 hack and slash of all time.
This game literally has everything you could want from the genre, and it hits its peak in every possible way.
The story is just pure aura from start to finish. The moment you boot it up, you instantly feel badass seeing my GOAT War aura farming on the title screen as you press start, and that feeling only gets stronger because of how the main character is written. Everything is explained beautifully, with real detail. The only word that fits is majestic.
Honestly, it feels like God of War 3, Devil May Cry, and The Legend of Zelda all fused into one, and the result is Darksiders 1. The combat vibes, the atmosphere, the structure. If you love those games, all straight 10/10s, this just makes everything better.
The combat speaks for itself. You are constantly upgrading weapons, and as you are upgrading and pushing toward max power, you genuinely feel yourself getting stronger. Unlocking new moves, styling your combos, chaining attacks, switching abilities, and absolutely demolishing enemies is insanely satisfying. Maximum aura at all times.
New gen games genuinely need to take notes, because this is top tier design done right, and this was the first entry in the franchise, which makes it even crazier.
A TRUE UNDERRATED LEGENDARY GAME.

reviews: Sort of like an updated America's Army but on a larger scale.  Mic and team work a must.  Lot's of fun. there are so many sweaty goons in this game but my god is it fun when you lock in with a proper squad shit
short_description: Squad is a tactical FPS that provides authentic combat experiences through teamwork, communication, and realistic combat. It bridges the gap between arcade shooter and military realism with 100-player battles, combined-arms warfare, and base building.

genres: Action, Adventure, Massively Multiplayer, Early Access
name: The Day Before
reviews: Interestingly, I did not ask Steam for a refund for this game. They gave it to me anyway. Creates a whole new meaning for the saying: "fake and gay" Really loved the game thought it was exactly as advertised. Iâ€™m really bummed out it got removed I throughly loved playing it the few days i had it.
short_description: The Day Before offers players a uniquely reimagined journey into post-apocalyptic open-world MMO survival set in the present day on the US East Coast following a deadly pandemic.

name: Tropico 6
reviews: Fun game Great enganging game Id keep playing if the expansions werent the price of my left nut, even on a discount. Like this games 6 years old and has another coming out next year. WHY.
short_description: El Presidente is back! Prove yourself once again as a feared dictator or peace-loving statesman on the island state of Tropico and shape the fate of your very own banana republic through four distinctive eras.

name: Trine Enchanted Edition
reviews:
its a very fun game, i used to play it a ton when i was younger. now that i have gotten a lil older, its not the same as it used to be lol. i still recommend this absolutely phenomenal game, please try it out! i should also mention the game looks VERY beautiful for how old it is. i will most likely refund the game, but it was worth giving it a try after so long :) It is a great story and classic concept, like Gobliiins. BUt it is EXTEMELY buggy.
 This game is fantastic it is engaging and i love playing it so why dont you play?
short_description: Three Heroes make their way through dangers untold in a fairytale world of great castles and strange machinery, featuring physics-based puzzles, beautiful sights and online co-op.

name: Sniper: Ghost Warrior 2
reviews:
Bought the game in sale. Way better than the first game. Story is like the first game, really short. Budget game worth playing, but don't expect too much. It's not like Sniper Elite franchise. My wife said if this review gets 50 likes and 5 awards, she will buy a case of beer, guys help me out.
 Completed twice on expert difficulty, much more improved graphics than the first, good storyline, act 1 is meh, act 2 and act 3 is great
short_description: Sniper: Ghost Warrior 2 takes the bulls-eye precision of its predecessor to new and exciting heights!

shit grapfics 
shit controls

2) constant lag/long loading and crashing.

3) controls are shit.

short_description: Fly fast, train hard, and learn well to become the Ultimate Dragon Trainer! Join Chief Hiccup and Toothless and embark on the thrilling adventures of DreamWorks Animationâ€™s â€˜How to Train Your Dragonâ€™. Play with your friends and explore mysterious worlds in this action-packed learning experience!

name: HITMANâ„¢
reviews:
It's good, interesting locations and multiple, very creative methods to eliminate your targets. ita a gearat game
 This game proves that not all terminal bald people can be killed and can be killers.
short_description: There is a world beyond ours. Beyond nations, justice, ethics. It never sleeps. It exists everywhere. And once you enter....there is no going back. Welcome to the World of Assassination. You are Agent 47, the world's ultimate assassin.

name: Knights and Merchants
reviews: Amazing Wonderful game from my childhood, would recommend the fan made kam remake which adds on to this too for extra campaigns. Top game! going back to childhood with this masterpiece!
short_description: KNIGHTS and MERCHANTS recreates the era of the Middle Ages. Apart from the purely fictitious geography of our world, all game elements and scenes are based on the Anglo-Saxon period, 1200 A.D. And we haven't used imaginary elements like fabled creatures, either. The player takes on the role of an ordinary captain in the Palace Guard.

name: The Talos Principle
reviews:
As someone who loves puzzle games, The Talos Principle made me feel like I found a goldmine. Itâ€™s not just one of the best puzzle games but actually one of the best games Iâ€™ve played in general. I canâ€™t even think of a single flaw or downside to the game.

First off, the levels are brilliantly designed. The mechanics are sufficiently varied, and honestly, such diverse mechanics deserve nothing less than this amazing level design. Iâ€™d be lying if I said I wasnâ€™t eager to see the next level every time I finished one. Some levels can be a bit exhausting (I spent like an hour for two or three puzzles) but finally overcoming them brings immense pleasure. I managed to complete all puzzles on my own except star ones because some of them are so criptic or hidden. Actually, there isnâ€™t much else to say. If youâ€™re a fan of puzzle games, this is absolutely a mustplay. I will definitely be playing the sequel after a little time. I also highly recommend picking up Road to Gehenna. Same things I said for main game aplies for this DLC aswell. (egypt levels makes me feel like I am playing Serious Sam 3 lmao) It will challenge your capacity to operate a simple connector without suffering a minor aneurysm or your patience after staring at a laser reciever for 20 minutes. Play this if you wish to have your confidence systematically dismantled and then rebuilt by a sarcastic computer terminal.

The music is stellar and the environments gleam with a longed for nostalgia, my favorite puzzle game of all time. I've come to realize that any 3d puzzle game is but a mere 3d platformer for the less gifted folk. Why open gates when you can jump over them. Fantastic game that made me use my brain, untill i used my legs.
short_description: The Talos Principle is a first-person puzzle game in the tradition of philosophical science fiction. Made by Croteam and written by Tom Jubert (FTL, The Swapper) and Jonas Kyratzes (The Sea Will Claim Everything).

name: Metal: Hellsinger
reviews:
10/10 mt bom. Jogue agora, sÃ³ musica boa Easily one of, if not *the* best game of 2022. Definitely not an easy one, but if you can master the gameplay and get used to matching most of your actions to the music's rhythm, it is incredibly satisfying and fun. Speaking of music: I don't consider myself to be a huge fan of metal music in general (or at least I wasn't, before playing the game), but good LORD the soundtrack is phenomenal, full of back-to-back bangers.

My only issue with Metal Hellsinger is that it's pretty short. Even if you get stuck at a few levels, you can probably still finish the story in like 6 or 8 hours, possibly even less. Sure, horde mode can add a couple extra hours of playtime (if you're into that), but it still makes me wish the main game was a bit longer.

Either way, it's an easy 9/10 for me, and a must-try for every FPS and metal fan. And if you love both, it's a no-brainer. ;) i love the combo of metal and a fps. wish the soundtrack was added once people buys this game cause the music is awesome
short_description: Slay to the rhythm of metal and vengeance on an infernal journey through the eight Hells. Make them fear the beat. Metal: Hellsinger is a rhythm FPS bursting with demons, badass weapons, and heavy metal music.

name: Artifact
reviews: we need it back They binned this game in development without trying to fix it. I want a refund. Very nice game
short_description: Artifact now features two games: Artifact Classic, the original Dota 2 trading card game, and Artifact Foundry, a special edition with streamlined gameplay, new cards, new single-player content, and an improved new player experience.

It's pretty much half the length of the main game, so there's a pretty good amount of content for what it is. I love all of the new enemies and guns. The sniper is really fun to use. The level design is great as always, and the connections to the first game were really well implemented. It retains the same feel from the first game that I really love. It could have ended up just feeling like a worse version of the main game, and even though I do think the main game does everything better, there's enough different stuff going on to make this a great experience on its own too. I love all of the soldier teammates that fight with you throughout the game. The change in main character makes for a lot of fun moments and an interesting and engaging time. I loved this.
